review_text: Great spot.
Enjoyed our stay, would return. Clean, quiet and private.

One of the best experiences I've had with an Airbnb host. Excellent communication and friendly attitudes. Trevor and Lisa bent over backwards to accommodate a request we had, and I really appreciate that they were so easy and friendly to work with.
Excellent experience all around.

Exactly as described. Lots of extra touches like the small folding table under the stairs. We learned we are not loft bedroom people but that was not the fault of the description...we are just too creaky. Good location with easy access to all parts of town. very efficient kitchen and cute! this is perfect for 1 or 2 people...when the hydrangeas bloom at the window it will be magical.
Very communicative.
We loved our stay. This tiny home was great. It had everything we needed. Cut decor.
This is a cute little place that makes you feel right at home. It also feels much bigger than it is due to an excellent use of the space.
Loved staying here! Sooo cute and small and super clean!! Had everything you might need!! Love Love Love!!!
Cutest place I have ever stayed.
Perfect place for the weekend!
We had a great time during our brief stay. The tiny home was very clean, and the pinball arcade was pretty cool.
Loved this little tiny house. Great place to stay with the kids. Cleverly designed for maximum use of space. We all enjoyed the pinball machines and the cute little garden area.
Great stay here :)

Super comfy tiny house with everything you would need, including plenty of TV options. The bed and linens were wonderful, the shower beautiful and great water. But by far the highlight was the pinball room; we played for an hour and laughed our heads off. Wish we could have stayed extra days.
Cute and quaint. Perfect little spot for a quick weekend.
Cutest little place! My 7 year old loved the pull out sofa (kid sized) and the pinball machines. We loved the ease and proximity to Great Wolf Lodge.

The tiny house was perfect for our weekend in Centralia for our kids wrestling tournament at the NW Sports Hub. Very cute, clean, and cozy and stocked with all the essentials. The pinball room was an added bonus — my son couldn’t get enough! Thank you so much for the wonderful hospitality.
-Apostols from North Shore, Oahu
This was a great little cozy place. Everything was great! I would definitely recommend this place.

absolutely satisfied with our stay. Kitchen not only had a good selection of coffee but creamer in the fridge. Bathroom had plenty of soft clean towels and plenty of good quality shampoo conditioner and body wash. living room had plenty of movies and boardgames to keep my son and daughter busy. the bed upstairs was very comfortable. the pinball room was a blast the kids loved it. would definitely stay again if in the area!
Trevor and Lisa were very responsive. My kids and I had a good time playing Pinball.
A very cute home to rest and relax during our weekend event. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
My daughter and I truly enjoyed our stay at Trevor and Lisa’s tiny home. It was perfect for our weekend visit to Centralia. We will definitely be back!

Charming little tiny home. Truly teeny, tiny, but our family of five enjoyed it well. ( we’re used to small spaces). Lisa was really responsive when there was an issue with the back porch lights coming on and into the bedroom window. The pinball room was off the hook, cute selection of movies and games. Our 6 and 4 year old loved it.
Loved staying here, great hosts!
Cute tiny home! Perfect for our family of three.
It was a great space, clean and close to our activities.

My husband and I went on a brewery tour in Centralia and this was our first time staying in a tiny house. Directions to the house were clear and it was easy to find. Although the place sits on the property with the the main home, it feels private as the entrance is facing away from the home. It was super clean and very cute, the bathroom was bigger than I expected and we had plenty of room to move around downstairs. As it was mentioned, the bedroom/loft is for sleeping not walking around. Outside of the home is another space with a few pinball machines that are free to play.
Trevor and Lisa's place is located close to shopping and restaurants. They are super communicative and we'd recommend their space if you're visiting the area.
I love this little tiny home. Super cozy with everything I needed. Great shower, comfortable bed, and private parking. I hope to stay here again in the future.
Cutest little tiny house in a sweet walkable neighborhood.
Cozy home 😊
What a beautiful little place. We booked last minute and came in late. It was all super easy coming and going. Would love to stay again when we have more time.
Perfect little bnb :)

This place is awesome. It was the perfect size for us and our 7 year old. Everything in the tiny house was really thoughtfully placed and we had everything we needed. The pinball room was so cool. Batman might be the coolest pinball game ever!
This is our second stay at trevor and lisas, the tiny house is one of our favorite airbnbs.
Love this cute place!
A great stay for our family! We look forward to coming back!
Repeat stayer shows how much I love it
This was a fun place to stay for my daughter and me. We have never experienced a tiny house!

This tiny home was perfect! Very clean and private with a super comfy bed. The shower was great and walkable to restaurants and arcade! The pinball game room did not disappoint! Wish we had more time to spend there! Lisa was very responsive and helpful. Would definitely recommend and stay again!
A great weekend stay! My son enjoyed the pinball machine room. Looking forward to staying there again!
Love staying here, so clean and just makes my traveling so much easier!
Give them a try !
Clean and cozy little house! I enjoyed my stay. Thoughtful details in the house like lighted outlets and awesome rain shower!

Super cute, convenient and clean tiny house! Me, my husband and my 12-year-old daughter were in town for a tournament that my daughter's softball team was playing in at the HUB. My daughter slept in the pullout bed downstairs and my husband and I were in the loft. Everything was so clean and cozy, the drive to the HUB was short, and the neighborhood seemed quiet and peaceful. We "oohed and ahhed" over the pinball machines and yard flamingos. Definitely will stay here again the next time we are in town.
Cute private home that I would definitely stay at again! Love how clean it is!!

While we recognize we were accessing the property at unusual hours, we were locked out of the house/key access pad and would encourage and secondary access plan. Other than that minor glitch, the property clean, cozy and comfortable! Would definitely stay here again.
Great little house to stay in on a short notice! Easy to access, super clean and had everything I needed for my work stay! Would definitely stay again!

My husband and I had a lovely stay in this tiny home. The house was clean, had a good amount of amenities, and was nicely decorated with hints of a flamingo theme. There was a parking spot right next to the house with easy access into the tiny house with clear instructions for your stay. Access to the pinball game room was a bonus fun addition.
Trevor and Lisa's tiny house was warm and inviting. Our kids LOVED the pinball room. Super close to Chehalis Centralia Railroad for Polar Express.

Incredible airBNB and hosts!
Thank you,
Blake
Very clean place that was perfect for me traveling alone. I would definitely stay there again without hesitation. Thank you!
Comfortable place, convenient location, and great value! Would stay here again.
This tiny house is a great spot to stay at! It was clean, super cute, and we enjoyed the privacy of having the whole space to ourselves.
Loved staying here! It was peaceful and clean.
Great last minute place hahaha.
We had a great stay. The little house was charming and clean.
cute tiny home. loved the pinball room.
it was very nice. was super clean and hosts were very friendly. definitely recommend!!! kinda small for 3 people but doable
Second stay & we returned because of the privacy, peace, pristine space & access to all the good local places. Excellent hosts. Thank you so much!
cute, clean and adorable air bnb. the host provided clear instructions and was responsive!

Beautiful place with lots of thoughtful details, we enjoyed coffee and hot cocoa. Beautiful yard and fun pinball machines. 15minute walk into town.
Trevor and Lisa even let us borrow thier pack-n-play to make traveling with a baby easier! Thank you!

We booked this place very last minute (within 30 mins from check in) as we were driving to Oregon from Seattle. My husband and I were traveling with our 6 year old and needed a place to sleep for the night. We were so glad we booked this tiny home instead of a hotel in downtown Portland. We checked in after 9pm and the home was cute, clean, cozy, had free parking, and had so many thoughtful touches. We got Pizza Hut for dinner that was a short drive away and we bought some groceries at Safeway to make breakfast in the morning. The kitchen in the tiny home had everything we needed to cook bacon and eggs for breakfast. Bathroom had a great shower with clean white towels! There were only 2 towels when we arrived so I texted the host for another and she delivered one right away. The bed was comfy and the sofa sleeper had a topper. The portable AC was strong and kept the room cool. The pinball room was a plus and my son had a lot of fun! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Really enjoy this place.return guest, everything I need, an then some.Host are great!
Loved our stay at the Tiny House! Clean, comfortable and the perfect size for a quick night in town for a wedding. 🦩

We stayed at the tiny house as a resting point on our way to Olympic National Park and it was absolutely perfect. Centralia is a nice town, very peaceful. The house was easy to find because they gave excellent directions. There's a parking spot is right next to the BnB which was great for unloading groceries so we could cook dinner in the well-equipped kitchen. The loft bed was very comfortable and we didn't have any issues with the overhead clearance. Trevor and Lisa have great attention to detail and were able to provide everything a guest could possibly need.
By Far One of the best places I’ve stayed very Quiet An Comfortable an has so much to offer in a small Package. Place was great!

This tiny home was small but impressively well stocked. They provided all the basic conveniences you might want, which made our travels easier. It was also incredibly clean! As an fyi, you'll probably have to duck going up to the bed, but that wasn't a problem/surprise.
The house was more than we expected in a tiny package! So much thought has been put in to comfort and covenience. Hosts are incredibly responsive and helpful!

Super easy to check in; place was really cute, clean and well stocked. Appreciate how easy staying there was, without complicated instructions for anything and no extra cleaning fee. Thanks for a fun stay!

Super clean, smallish but we knew that and it was totally fine for our needs. Trevor and Lisa communicated well and were very supportive and accommodating when we had to change date by a day due to fires! I recommend this Tiny House if you're ok with a 'tiny house.' :-)
Their place was cozy, clean, and conveniently located. Would definitely stay again!
This place was extremely clean and cute. The host was very responsive.
We’ve had a great time at the tiny house of Trevor and Lisa! Super kind hosts and a super lovely little house:)

Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful!
A hidden gem in a cute neighborhood became the perfect place for our family to put another check mark on our summer bucket list. Our stay happened to coincide with a heatwave but the host was thoughtful and considerate in starting the AC before we arrived. I appreciate the clear instructions, self check-in, and privacy during our stay. The pinball room was really cool and my boys also enjoyed the selection of board games and movies. We took the hosts recommendation and went to Insert Coin and had a blast! This has to be the coolest place to stay in the area, so much better than a hotel!

We visited Centralia for a wedding that was taking place in Onalaska and reached out about 2 weeks prior. We where driving from Seattle and needed to check in early to get ready for the wedding. Trevor and Lisa informed me they would let me know that day how soon I could arrive since the previous gusts didn’t need to check out till 11 and there was a cleaning time. They messaged me day of and let me know I could check in after 12. That was a life saver! So grateful. The place is cute, clean, cozy and had everything you need. They even had one of those chargers with all USB connectors. We only stayed the night but wish we could of stayed longer. The kids enjoyed the pinball room before we checked out. The pictures don’t do justice on how cute the actual place is.

Mom, son and I stayed overnight enroute to the Oregon Coast. After a long day of travel we found the Tiny Home suited all of our needs from the AC to the specialty teas and board games.
And, the bonus… the pinball machine games room!
Thank you Trevor and Lisa!

This was our first stay in a tiny home and it was perfect! Cute, super clean, and with all the amenities we could need and more!
It felt bigger than it was. The bed was super comfy, which is always important! The hosts were very welcoming. We would love to go back! We didn’t have a chance to check out the pinball room! Next time! Highly recommend!
Great, cozy place! Highly recommend

Great tiny house, super well equiped and cozy. We spent two days with our three years old son and we felt like at home. The easy and flexible check in and easy communication with Lisa and Trevor rounded the expirience. highly recommended!
Loved our time here! The place I think exceeded the photos as the pictures didn’t do it justice to how nice it was. Spacious for two of us and have everything we needed. 10000% recommend this place
Beautiful tiny house, comfortable and super clean. Close to restaurants.
Really enjoyed our stay. Quiet little neighborhood close to restaurants and stores. Easy access. Cozy spot.
Awesome place with very friendly and responsive hosts in a quiet neighborhood. Multiple small touches made our experience even that much better. Would definitely stay here again!

No detail was skipped in this tiny house to make everything work in this tiny 'stage'. From comfort, design, and even amenities, it's been well thought out, and at length. Too many little extra touches to list. We'll definitely be back.
Thanks for your wonderful little place and amazing customer service and the pinball... how could I forget that pinball room!!! This place is so cool!!!
Thanks so much,
Vinny

This place is a true tiny house, like you read about. Truly adorable too, with every clever modern convenience and decor. Trevor and Lisa offer a very clean and tidy lodging to their guests, and promptly respond to any inquiries. The stairs to the loft are steep, and the loft area ceiling low, but neither kept us from enjoying a good night’s rest. And then the added benefit of the fine pinball machines. So nice to share your collection with your guests. Had a great stay here and wouldn’t hesitate to stay again while visiting the area.
Mary and Art

We stayed at Trevor and Lisa’s place on our way to Canada. The place was furnished with cute and functional furniture and the bed was comfortable. If you are very tall watch your head upstairs! The pinball room was so fun and we had a good stay.
The home was very nice and cozy. Breakfast recommendation was amazing!

A darn-near new Tiny House all to ourselves, very friendly and communicative hosts — and a whole separate outbuilding with pinball machines to play!!! Seriously, why do the reviews only go up to 5 stars?

Don’t miss out on staying at Trevor and Lisa’s house! I had to spend a few days in Centralia working at the local hospital and this was the perfect place to rest and relax. The bed was super comfortable and I slept great every night. I loved walking around in the evenings and seeing all the beautiful houses in the surrounding neighborhoods. Trevor and Lisa were also super responsive and helpful when I messed up my reservation and I was able to get it rebooked quickly with their help. I highly recommend staying here!
We loved our stay here. The place is so clean and comfortable. Would 100% recommend!
Perfect for our small family of four for a night. Kids loved the pinball room, as expected! Super comfortable adult bed. Clean and lovely!
the place is amazing. I love it so much.

This tiny house is adorable and feels very spacious despite being a tiny home. The flamingo theme was amazing as well! Every aspect of the house was extremely well kept with modern and brand new appliances. Trevor and Lisa provided everything we could’ve asked for and then some. We were in town for a wedding and they were even kind enough to offer an iron and ironing board. The pinball room is a blast and the neighborhood was quiet and peaceful which made for a great place to walk. Be sure to check out the Juice Box for great beer on top and live music/shows. The Centerville Cafe is fantastic for breakfast. We will definitely stay here again if we’re in Centralia or anywhere nearby! Thank you Trevor and Lisa!
very comfortable and efficient, easy get to. thank you!

Trevor and Lisa’s place was easy to find, very clean and charming! Communication was great and upon finding out I was going to have my young daughter with me, they left a special treat which we both enjoyed :)
outstanding, comfortable and fun place to stay. the availability of parking right next to the unit works great for me also
Such a fun place! Comfortable, cozy, felt right at home!
It’s was a great place to stay for one night. Nice mattress and pillows. Train noises did not bother me much. Would absolutely stay again. Thank you!

Thank you so much for letting us stay in your darling tiny house. It was perfect for my daughter and myself. We really appreciate it! And the pinball house was such a fun way to spend some time together!!

This tiny house was so cute and perfect. Definitely felt spacious enough and all the details were so well thought out. Pinball was an amazing fun bonus. Hosts were so helpful and communicative. Would stay here time and time again. Wish there was one of these in every town.
Trevor and Lisa’s place was just as described, exactly what I was hoping for and conveniently located. Would recommend and will definitely stay again when we’re in town.
Greatest hosts, the tiny home was done very well! Couldn't have been any better really!!
This tiny home was super cute and very modern / clean! Would highly recommend anyone to stay here ☺️
Cozy & comfortable & private. We enjoyed our stay so much & hope to spread the word & return ourselves. Thank you!
Fantastic stay would be happy to stay here again next time I’m in Seattle
Cute and charming! Loved the flamingo theme :)
awesome place to stay. very accommodating
Had a wind time, wish we could have stayed longer!

I’ve never stayed at a tiny home. This one was a super experience! The bathroom was good-sized, the kitchenette was awesome, and everything was clean and well cared for. Loved the boardgames- had fun playing Connect 4. Would recommend! A+
Super cute place. Easy check in. Clean and comfortable. Would definitly stay again.

If I am able to go back to Centralia to continue the yearly activity I was there for, I will definitely attempt to book the Tiny House. It is located perfectly for whatever you want or need to do, and everything in the house is well-planned and so functional. You don't feel like you are in a tiny place. All the amenities are awesome. The loft is easy to get to and my sleep was very sound! The neighborhood is very quiet and safe. I made the mistake (sarcasm here!) of getting into the pinball room.....I was pretty hardcore at pinball in 8th grade. I am now almost 67 years old. Those machines brought back so many memories from the late 60s---It made me so happy to play these machines! You also have to dig on the flamingo farm. I sent pics to my wife and she loved it! Anyway, this is a place that I would have no hesitation returning to. Much, much better than any hotel room you may find in Centralia! Also...go to O'Blarneys about 3/4 mile away. Great food and brew.

Would definitely rent from Trevor and Lisa again. My family rented 4 different Airbnb's in Centralia for a family event and this tiny house was voted best in all categories: communication, cleanliness, amenities, comfort of bed, shower, rate and location! Highly recommend this tiny home.
will definitely stay here again if we're in the area, super quaint and cute tiny home, cool pinball machines and close to town and things to do.

this is the best airbnb I have ever stayed in. the amenities and level of comfort are absolutely amazing. not only is the space private, but it has anything you could need while you're there. the pinball machines are also super fun!! a great place to stay and I would highly recommend it.
Recommend. Thoughtful touches have been added to the place.
The stay was a good experience, the pinball shed was my favorite part about the stay. :)
We had a lovely stay at Trevor & Lisa’s tiny house. It was super comfortable, very clean. Will definitely stay here again!
The tiny house was beautiful and very well laid out, it was very quiet and peaceful.

The Tiny House was just right for a couple and a 16 yr old. We were in town for a baseball event at the Sports Hub, and the location was perfect. Went to Insert Coin per their suggestion, and had a great time playing old school Mario while eating pizza right at our table!
Would definitely stay again when in Centralia!

Above and beyond any expectation, I was there for a month while doing work business. Felt like home, Trevor and Lisa had everything set up for a very comfortable stay. The pinball room was a great extra, I also really liked the private parking and friendly neighborhood. I would give it a 6 star review it I could…
Trevor and Lisa's place was just as described, and had everything I needed. A plus was playing the pinball machines. I loved it! Clean and comfortable. Thank you!
This was one of my favorite air b n bs ever ! It’s so peaceful & perfect for a quiet getaway & I loved the design of the tiny home , it’s like a personal version of a little home bunk bed.
Super fun! Kids loved the pinball. Old Mary Poppins on TV was great with popcorn. Thanks!
I felt extremely safe even being alone, great amenities, local fun & amazing pinball room! hosts are responsive and flexible!
Enjoyed my stay here! Communication was easy, everything went smoothly, and had a blast playing pinball! It was also easy to walk to some great restaurants and fun places.
Such a good setup for the space available. super nice fixtures. Very clean and super nice bed. We definitely would go back!
Attended a wedding in Chehalis and this place was not too far! Beautiful, new tiny home with all the amenities one may need! Definitely recommend if you are staying in the Centralia/Chehalis area :)
This space awesome, especially you are short and like compact and comfy places! Great amenities and clean!!

Perfect for 2 people
loved pinball
Trevor and Lisa have an amazing place. Clean, great location, extremely fast internet. Perfect for my wfh needs while I visited family. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip.

Great place that had everything we needed! The pinball machines were a treat for the kids! The place is very clean and well thought out for the size. Trevor was an excellent communicator for any questions that we had! Very happy that we chose to stay here!

The tiny house was so perfect!! It was easy to find and cozy, clean and fun for the first two nights of our honeymoon. Easy access with self check in, parking right next to the house & everything we needed. It’s well kept and the pinball room was a fun addition to the whole experience! Trevor and Lisa sent us a few helpful messages and let us know we could park out back by the tiny house after the first night. Very comfy bed and we appreciated the stairs because so many tiny homes have ladders lol
Amazing hosts! Great communication, nice place and I would for sure stay there again!

Absolutely loved this little place and would absolutely stay again. Only stayed for one night and wish we had more time to stay longer. Had everything we needed and was such a clean and cozy spot. Communication was great and it was easy to check in and check out. Overall a great experience and so happy we chose this.
Great little place. Clean and nice. Loved it.
Our stay was great, it was clean, easy to access and comfortable! Really close to a fun little historic downtown! So fun!
Great little spot. Highly recommend.
nice little getaway
perfect get away for a reset and recharge
Would return there any time. The tiny house together with the beautifully restored pinball machines, was a unique and unforgettable experience.

Such a beautiful tiny house! We visited Mount Rainier and Mount St Helens during our stay and the location was very good. Also the small town is nice. Trevor was a very good host and gave us some good recommendations. Would come back any time.

So fun to stay here! I recommend it after a day at Mt St Helens.
Make sure you leave time for the pinball room!

Very detailed, scrupulously clean , quiet, and restful...AC was a big bonus...and the pinball was a super plus too . very clean and very easy to manuver!
Thank You!

I can't say enough great things about this spot. Downtown Centralia impressed me in general and this place is conveniently located to enjoy it. This tiny home will make you romanticize living simply and lushly. The pinball room should not be overlooked either. My husband and I would love to stay here again!
We had a great time staying in Trevor's tiny house. The layout feels so roomy and the bed was extremely comfortable. Even the bathroom had plenty of room. We would definitely stay here again!
what a great tiny home. The pinball room was awesome!! Definitely would come back
Loved this tiny space. So thoughtfully laid out to maximize the space. The bedroom loft is low, but very doable. Bed is so comfy. Kitchen has all you need. Love the rain shower in the bathroom.
Very fun stay! Pinball room was a fun amenity.
Cool little place, and was really fun to see how the’ve fixed up the property around this mini-home. Slept great!
Super clean and quaint! Loved the pinball machines, and the host were very friendly and welcoming. We will be back again!

Very cute tiny house to stay in! A lot of thought was put into this place to make it comfy down to the little things like having an adapter for every type of phone charger. Communication was excellent all the way through our stay. Easy to find with the directions they provide with safe parking right outside the airbnb. Easy access with the provided code. Wish we could have stayed longer than a night so we could play in the pinball room, looks like it would be a lot of fun! Great location as well! Highly suggest staying here!
Place is super nice and the hosts are great
Spectacular stay! Above and beyond.

great little place
loved our stay

Centralia Square is a clean, cute, boutique hotel. We chose the hostel style room, knowing we would be getting in late and leaving early. It was such a great option for a one night stay! The place and the people were njce. All matched the description. The restaurant downstairs was also fantastic.
Old Centralia offers much nostalgia sweet little town

Such a beautiful spot if you love historic places! The building is beautifully renovated and you can see the original charm in the entire space. Bed was very comfortable and room was clean and cute. The breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was phenomenal!
Very cozy and clean room. It was very quiet in the building, and having a way to enter after hours was accommodating. Beautiful building, very well maintained and such a fun history.
I love staying here. Right in downtown, clean and cozy, great vintage feel. I don't need fancy, just simple and timeless. This spot fills the bill!

Really wonderful renovations. Peeked in at one of the ballrooms and they really did a nice job with the renovation.
Nice simple room that was clean.
My favorite please to stay in Lewis county.
Awesome place!

This was my second stay at Centralia Square, four nights each time. Clean, quaint. I've only stayed in small rooms w/ shared restroom and shower facilities. It's always worked out very well. I was traveling solo. The rooms don't offer much if you're trying to get any work done. Not much room to stretch out. No desk or work chair. But the WIFI was stronger this time around. The rooms I've stayed in are on the same side of the building as the RR tracks, and trains run through pretty frequently throughout the night. But ear plugs are provided if you need. Good coffee in the lobby each morning. I'll stay again next time I'm in the area.

I enjoyed the space. I came after hours and so it was a bit hard to figure out how to enter. The place is beautiful and enjoyable. The room was a bit smaller than I had thought, but got the job done. I love the feel to the 1920s so that makes sense why the room was smaller. Definitely stay again.

Centralia Square was a fun spot for any history buff that wants to spend a night in the past. The whole building was beautifully restored to a 1920’s era feeling, with some modern amenities. The location was convenient to the event we were going to and had plenty of food options within walking distance. Berry Fields downstairs had a delicious breakfast menu.

Stayed here for a night while passing through for a work trip, wonderful experience! Reception was kind, quick, and informative about places and hotel features. Room was very cozy and fit the style, felt like a vintage hotel with modern amenities! The communal bathroom was clean and easily accessible, and the shower room was private with good water pressure and temperature. WiFi was good. You can hear the trains and cars passing outside, as well as other guests in the hallway but they provided earplugs if you need them! Not much else they can do and I’m a heavy sleeper so it didn’t bother me much. I didn’t stay during an event so I’m not sure how that would affect guests but they have a really good handle on things and care about their guests and the hotel. The aesthetics and decor were cool and parking was easy. Lastly, the cafe downstairs serves great breakfast for good price. Overall an awesome experience, hope to stay here again!

If you are looking for a beautiful, unique and cozy space to stay this is for you! They perfectly capture the glory of the 1920s while blending just enough amenities from this era for you to fell right at home. The linens are divine and the shared bathroom area is very clean and accessible.
We really loved the room and all the little touches; the sinks and fixtures are stunning!
The cafe downstairs is exceptional, a must try!
Thank you so much for a wonderful experience.
A great vintage hotel with lots of charm. The roof patio is a wonderful place to unwind.
What a lovely place! Enjoyed our time. Would come again.
Cool building. Very comfy bed. Fair value. Would stay again!
Has old-time charm, responsive host, and a nice terrace overlooking the park. Headed out early but the cafe looked very appealing.
It was beautiful and quaint boutique hotel. Loved that it had modern amenities in such a historical place.

Centralia is not a hot bed of tourism but it is a nice small town in America. We were attending a wedding and asked if we could check in early to get dressed - the hostess was very gracious and helped us out. The the restaurant serves a great breakfast ( I like hash browns and these were the best I ever had). Very cool old hotel
This is a vintage hotel with separate, shared bathroom and shower. Everything was spotless. Check in was very smooth. Very responsive host. Good bar/restaurant attached.
We loved our stay - nice historic hotel across from a beautiful park - we'll definitely stay again!
I love the vision of restoring the old building. It was really neat to stay in a place with history and charm. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The facilities were spotless and clean.
Everything was as advertised. No issues with the shared bathroom and shower. Very clean. Beautiful old building.
The accommodations were exactly as described. I would stay there again!
I've stayed here several times to visit family. It's always great!

We were just passing through town and didn't get to enjoy all of the amenities that were offered but the room was great, great communication, and an overall awesome place to stay! The hotel has a very nostalgic feel for me and is very rich in history. Everything was clean and orderly, I would definitely stay here again!

My husband and I decided last minute to take a weekend trip and Centralia Square seemed affordable and charming. We weren’t completely sure what to expect when we got there, but it absolutely delivered! It was very cute and we never ran into anyone in or near the shared restroom.
We had a lovely time at this charming, unique hotel!
Always a great place to stay!

The coolest thing about this place:
It's a short distance from the train station making for a memorable trip by train.
I was surprised to find the biggest pot belly stove in the world at McMenamins also a block from the train

Lovely hotel! Very nice staff. It was peaceful. I love the vintage charm.
Don't forget your slippers!

Great walkable, convenient location. We were able to walk to dinner at a nearby restaurant and a performance at Corbet Theater in the evening and then to breakfast at another nearby restaurant in the morning. You share the bathroom and shower with the other guests, but they were very clean and had locking doors so we still had plenty of privacy. The hallways and bathroom didn’t seem to be heated so they were chilly, but our room was warm and there was an extra blanket. Comfy bed - we both slept great!

If you're thinking about staying in Centralia, Centralia Square is the absolute best hotel. Their hospitality is out of this world! I've never seen better care from any other hotel. The hotel itself is very unique and a rare lifetime experience. It really transports you back in time.

Exactly what is listed! Very nice staff and location. Defiantly loud so if you’re a light sleeper I can’t recommend. Bathroom plumbing/cleaning definitely needs a bit of an upgrade though. Overall good for the price.

This Boutique Hotel is perfectly located downtown Centralia. It is walking distance to eateries, bars, and shopping. The building has a lot of history and the preservation is appreciated by folks who want a chance to walk in the past.
This room is located next to the shower room and is very close to the bathroom. May not be suitable for the light sleeper, but they intuitively provide earplugs.
I will keep this place in mind for future visits to the area.
Beautiful
Fun little piece of history
Great location and super clean. Staff where very helpful. Loved the history and attention to detail. Bed are comfy.

Amazing historic property with so much charm and character. Highly recommend a stay at this hotel - staff was accommodating and friendly, room was adorable, and the historic restoration was mind-boggling. Walking distance to super cute downtown and delicious breakfast spot right in the same building. Get there!
Nice accommodations, good price, very near trains which run much of the night. Hotel provides little earplugs but sleeping medication works best for some!
Great room and historical building.
My stay was simple and easy. The room was clean and accurately described. Self check-in was super easy.
Excellent stay! Beautiful hotel!

What a charming hotel! If you appreciate authentic historic, with all its quirks, you'll love this wonderful 1920's hotel. It has a perfect blend of modern conveniences (air conditioning, wi-fi) with old fashioned (old wood floors, separate hot and cold taps, funky light switches). They have a lovely terrace that looks out on a central square park. I can't wait to stay there again.

A little gem! Centralia was a fun, safe, clean, and exceptionally quaint stay for my partner and I during a 1 night overnight to breakup a long drive. We stayed in a room without a toilet or shower and had no issues at all. The room was clean and had very comfortable bedding. There was a powerful AC unit and a beautiful big window. This boutique hotel is unique and a great stay! There are also two highly rated restaurants attached to the building so everything was really convenient.

This is my 4th stay here as I have family living in the area. I so appreciate this place as it is in my budget. The rooms are extremely comfy and the staff is very helpful. Their smallest rooms only have a sink you have to go down the hall to shower and use the toilet. They're very up front about it. That being said, they provide you a bathrobe to walk down the hall in and everything has always been clean every time I've stayed here. I also have never had to wait to use the facilities and I rarely have seen anyone. For being an old building the rooms are very comfortable temperature wise. Each room has it's own thermostat. I stayed here in super hot weather last summer and the room was perfectly cool. I totally recommend this place!! There are also fun restaurants and shops within walking distance. I plan to keep staying here when i visit!!
A must stay if you enjoy history. Lots of old charm and pictures.
Great hotel! Noise was light during our stay but the amenities provided were more than enough for a comfortable stay.
Great vintage place to stay. Hosts were great.

We had a great stay! Very walkable to the historic downtown. We really enjoyed the local businesses!
There’s a restaurant on the first floor with excellent food! Great value and a beautiful place!
You can expect to feel comfortable and cared for. Historic luxury at an affordable rate!!! Sharing the bathroom shower was a non issue and I never needed the earplugs provided. Very clean.
You can expected a clean, comfortable, cozy, and safe location to relax, unwind, and rest…..

We had a pleasant stay. As other reviewers mention, and the hosts warned me, it can be loud. There was a wedding on site the night we stayed, but the hosts kindly provide ear plugs. I put some white noise on my phone and had no issue going to sleep while the party roared on downstairs.
My partner and I enjoyed our stay at Centralia Square! We really appreciated its historical character and proximity to downtown. We’d stay again!
Fun piece of history to stay at! Sharing a restroom and shower was not bad at all. There was no waiting. Would definitely stay here again!

I was unable to stay at Centralia Square due to getting sick the day that I was supposed to check in. I let them know and they were super understanding and gracious about it. I'm giving them 5 stars based on their communication and service. I feel to take any stars away from any categories that I wasn't able to actually experience, such as cleanliness, accuracy, location, etc, would do a disservice to their communication and understanding of my situation. I will definitely keep them in mind for my next trip.
Amazing value, always clean and great communication. I have stayed here multiple times on my travels for work and will continue to do so.

We booked a room not knowing what to expect with a shared bathroom. The hotel was quiet and the bathrooms were close so we did not mind. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. I will stay there again.

I will stay here again! A lovely retreat while visiting my family during a difficult time. The history of the property is worth your time. This room is exactly as described. A very spacious room with a sink, mirror and conveniently located outlet. The large closet held my luggage and other items, so they were out of the way. I really appreciated the cozy robe and excellent towels. Sheets on the bed were soft, and an extra blanket was available. The in-room air conditioner kept me comfortable. The staff were friendly and accommodating. Halls were quiet and calm regardless of the shared bath and shower. The shower room was right-sized with a handy bench. I live in an urban area so the trains did not disturb me, but ear plugs were available for use. I highly recommend a stay at Centralia Square. And, while there check out the Berry Cafe conveniently located on the main level.
Great value and friendly staff
Nice clean room and friendly staff. Great value.
A small individual room with a sink and closet. Shared bathroom and shower room. It was clean and accommodating, really enjoyed my stay!
This place is so cute! A great place to unwind. We went to mcmenamins a few blocks down for dinner and that was awesome as well. In the morning, the antique mall was a cute place to look at.
If you like trains, you'll be very happy. Otherwise quiet and relaxing.

Fine place for a stop over. The room was much smaller than it looked in pictures but it was okay for a night. The stalls in the shared bathroom are extremely small- like bang your knees on the door type small. Found myself wishing there had been more evidence of extra cleaning in a shared space like that. AC and Wifi worked well.
A beautiful place to stay in that offers such a unique accommodation experience

This was a random stopover for my partner and I and it was such an awesome experience. We loved all the unique historic touches but felt the comfort of modern amenities (like A/C which is a treat for us!). The staff is kind enough to provide earplugs because it does get a bit noisy, but for a Saturday night, we had no problem and other guests in the hotel were quiet as well. You can tell a lot of work was put into this place and the staff was so kind as well.
Great

I found this little hotel to be completely charming. First of all you can’t beat the price for a clean and well-appointed room. The front desk staff were super friendly and accommodating. My room had a lovely view of the hillside (I did have to overlook the neon auto parts sign below -easy enough). Yes there is a nearby train but I routinely use earplugs so it wasn’t a big issue. I think it woke me twice but not in an alarming way, more like an “oh yes, that’s the train” way. Worse than the train, for me, was the too-intense laundry soap smell on the sheets.
The shared bathroom was never occupied when I went in, and other guests were very quiet.
In all, the place is charming, clean, and it suit my needs.I will definitely stay here again when I’m in the area.
the area was a very nice area for a hotel botique
Charming and elegant vintage appeal in a centrally located spot. I loved staying here. Super friendly staff and delicious food options.

Nicely renovated place to stay, that has a lot of history to share and experience. You need to understand what to expect when staying here. The halls can be noisy when loud people and kids come through. The management does their best with the signs and carpet runners. It is all part of the nuisance of the place, which is very much appreciated and valued at the Square. Nice Terrace and view to the park across the street on one side.
The ball room is beautiful and well appointed. Very impressive place to rent for events and get togethers , great potential.
The shower and restroom down the hall is just fine, bring your foot wear and enjoy the privacy once in the facilities. I did not see anyone else use the bathroom or shower. Bed was comfortable and the street noise was nothing bad. Train is soothing to me and did not even notice it. I did not need the ear plugs they offer. Its an old place with creaks and squeaks on the stairs and floors through out the place.
Nice bar attached and the staff at the hotel are all very nice it seems.
I look forward to my next stay.
Nice place to stay, very clean, felt safe. Convenient location. Restaurant downstairs with good food. No TV but there is WiFi. Room was small but bed was very comfortable. I would stay here again.
Excellent location within walking distance of several antique shops and restaurants. Gorgeous historical building. Great weekend getaway!
Centralia square has been beautifully remodeled. Would stay again
An absolutely perfect location and an amazing place, beautifully restored. Great communication and an easy check in process.
pretty sure its haunted!

The room was perfect for what I needed. The train was my only complaint and I didn't wear the earplugs out of stubbornness, so that was my fault. The staff were so friendly. I really liked the soft large robe! I don't know if there were other guests, as I didn't hear anyone but me.
I actually booked next week already!!!
Would not stay anywhere else the best!!!

Excellent location in downtown Chehalis. The staff is very welcoming and kind. Clean, quite, and comfortable. Berry Fields restaurant downstairs is delicious and so convenient and now open later until 7pm.- Perfect to order dinner to take to your room.
Perfect!

Great value and love the historic aspect of this hotel. Not overly crazy about sharing a bathroom, but there was never a conflict with other guests and you cannot beat the price. Chari was wonderfully accommodating.

Clean, no frills Euro style room (shared bathroom) in a beautiful old building walking distance to everything downtown. We enjoyed our stay, especially the cold AC :) Great service and responsiveness from our host and solid dining options in the building. I would definitely recommend to anyone staying in the area.

I really enjoyed staying here. It was relaxing and most places are within walking distance, like Mcmenamin's etc. There are a few things to consider: there is a shared restroom and shower, train noise, and cruising on Saturday nights. Overall it was worth it. I hope the rest of the restoration goes well.
Best hotel experience in the area
Very clean rooms. I had a unit with the bathroom down the hall and the facilities were always spotless, plus there was a great shower.
Centralia Square was a wonderful place to stay the night. Classic European charm.

Another pleasant night's stay at Centralia Square. A major reason I choose this place is that it is not a cookie cutter motel. Built about a hundred years ago but updated. Don't expect a TV but the wireless is great. High cleanliness standard and comfortable bed. Great value.
This is a really cool place to stay. Great value. It has been updated tastefully and is not haunted. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Stayed for one-night on a west coast road trip. Perfect stay! Great value. Good location with plenty of nearby food options available and close to the highway. On-site restaurant and Antique Mall downstairs!
It was a good place for cheap
Great location, value and friendly and helpful staff.

This truly was a wonderful place to stay. Right downtown, close to cafes and all the great Antique shops. Very clean and well maintained. They did a lovely job maintaining the vintage feel as if you'd just stepped into a 1930's movie.
I love the location in downtown Centralia. The staff was incredible. I was late checking in and the host was so kind and pleasant. Check in was super easy. The bed is very comfortable!!
Good place in a charming historic building, in the center of town.
Good value, surprisingly quiet and good location.

I did not stay here personally, I booked this hotel for my cousin who was participating in my wedding. She reported that her stay was pleasant! Would recommend to a friend looking for an affordable and comfortable place to stay.
Nice place with bars and restaurants all around.

Wonderful experience. The room is small but it's all a couple needs. The access to the terrace for having our own breakfast and dinner was awesome. There is a bit of noise from your neighbors if they are inconsiderate, but it was never a problem for sleeping. Everything was sparkling clean. We wished wifi reached the terrace and also suggested the closet have a rod instead of hooks - minor inconveniences.
Absolutely recommend staying here

I had a splendid adventure weekend exploring Centralia and this charming historic boutique hotel is at the center of it all! I spent a long holiday weekend here and loved everything about it. It inspired me to write, read, relax and transcend to another place in time. Some nights I felt like I had the place all to myself. On Saturday there were two events and the whole place came alive with music and festivities. A truly unique offering that I will definitely be making my way back to soon!
This was a unique place to stay and inexpensive. It was fun to stay in one of the three rooms our family reserved.
At first, I thought the bathroom/shower situation would not be ideal, but it turned out to be just fine. This place is definitely the best bang for your buck!
Absolutely the best value in the business! Wonderful location, close to the main drag with all the restaurants, bars, and theatre.
Enjoyed my stay.

Very much a historical hotel, smells and all. Very close to the train trucks, with multiple passing trains several times a night. Wondering if a free breakfast would make the place a little more appealing. I probably wouldn’t recommend this place again. It’s a little creepy.

A true historically significant location. Great touches and two wonderful restaurants on site for morning and evening meals. The hotel is kept very clean, love the monogram towels! Wonderful location for events.
If you love some history it is a great step into the past. Outstanding location and hospitality. Two of the beat restaurants in town right in the building!
If you are into old art 1920's style decor, def check this place out! Staff was super friendly!!
Great price, quirky atmosphere, cool building. A fun place to stay in Centralia!
Fun vintage building right in the best part of Centrailia. Super cool!

If you are a history or architecture buff you will love this old timey hotel. If you are attending an event at the Ballroom there you might like to sleep over too. However if you think hotel and imagine a nice room with a bathroom, TV, fridge, microwave and maybe even coffeemaker you will be disappointed like I was. Up many flights of steps you will get a comfortable bed, a sink and a chair. Like those eat it and beat it diners this is a go to sleep get up and go type of hotel with no frills whatsoever. And the $15 cleaning fee seemed oddly tacked on.
Great old world hotel. Transport yourself to an era long gone. Love cool old places and this hotel is one. Would stay again.
Charming hotel and town!

Centralia Square Hotel is much like McMenamin's nearby but a block further from the train tracks, which is important knowledge in that the trains roll through Centralia in the middle of the night. I slept better here than at Olympic Club. Another perk: Amazing A/C. The Pac NW doesn't get hot but so many weeks of the year, but it was 91 the day I stayed here and I was very glad the room was nice and cool when I arrived. The room was spotless, I got in late and left before breakfast, so no experience of those options.

I was attending a conference at the great wolf lodge but decided to go with this more affordable option and I couldn't be happier with my decision! The great wolf was only a 15 minute drive away and my stay in centralia afforded me many more dining and drinking options! The hotel is in a wonderful location in the heart of downtown centralia. Parking was a breeze every day. The hotel itself was very quiet and peaceful but there is a train track nearby and trains come by frequently if you are a light sleeper. The hotel did provide ear plugs to combat that noise, however. The room is basic with just a sink. You will have to shower and use the restroom down the hall, but this room is conveniently right next door to both. Both the toilets and the shower were always clean and I never had to compete for the shower in the morning. They provide robes which was handy when getting from the shower back to the room. This is a great place to stay off you want to unplug and enjoy other things in life (no tv in the room). I particularly enjoyed the wonderful terrace where I read my book and sipped some wine one night and ate my dinner the next. I would absolutely stay again and recommend!

wonderful stay, like taking a step back in time! The only thing to be aware of is that the train tracks are a block and a half away, but ear plugs are provided, and I never really noticed them during the night. :)

This is a charming hotel with a cute cafe and antique mall in the same building! Everyone we encountered were friendly and helpful. Note that there are shared bathrooms (which did not bother us - but still good to know) and the train can be heard from the hotel.
We would definitely come stay again if we find ourselves in Centralia in the future.
We loved our stay and the 5 star dining at The Branch Cafe. Exploring the antique stores was great fun

Fantastic Historical Hotel! The hosts were very responsive with communication and the check in couldn’t have been easier. We were even able to have an early check in. The bed in our room was very comfortable and the sheets extremely soft. The room also had an individually controlled ductless heating and AC unit with user guide inside room. The shared bathroom and shower were in separate rooms, so no wait in the morning. Call me an old soul but it is refreshing to have the simpler life style when enjoying the architectural marvels of the past. Would definitely stay here again!

Beautiful old hotel with clean room and friendly check in. I’m not sure how many other guests were there but my room was really quiet except for the trains-which they provided earplugs for! My room was spacious, the bed was comfortable.On the first floor is an old style diner with the most amazing looking desserts. The breakfast there was delicious.
Perfect location in downtown. Room was clean and the shared bathrooms were too
Funky rooms and super comfy bed 👍
You have to make sure you understand the bathrooms and showers are shared, I loved it! Great place. Only downfall is all the trains...

Beautiful historic building. The rooms are really, really clean. The breakfast is NOT included with the room lol but the room was a fair price so no complaints. Great location and a good experience staying in a bit of history :) Thank You
This is a very good bargain if you are in the area. I was so happy to find this Historic Gem right in the middle of town. Friendly staff and comfortable rooms.
We had a great stay! The room was as expected and the sheets/towels all smelled amazing! We loved hearing about the history of the building!

Such a wonderful place to stay! We really liked all the windows at the cabin, you can easily enjoy the scene of forest no matter where you are (even at the bathroom!). It was also great to read “the cabin’s story” in the guest book, it’s very interesting to see how the place connects to the local community.
Looking forward to stay here again!

Staying in Janet’s cabin was perfect, exactly what we needed! It was so peaceful, clean, and the perfect amount of space for two. Thank you for sharing your amazing cabin. We will definitely be back to stay next time we are in the area.

We were looking for a tree house but the this cabin gave us amazing time which we were completely unexpecting. We celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary and beautiful star gazing from the upper deck of the cabin left us in awe. We extend our thanks to Janet and Christian for letting us stay and making our special day even more memorable with their incredible creation of THE CABIN. ❤️
Most incredible little cabin I’ve ever seen. Highly recommend, it’s beautiful.

Gosh - I can't say enough good about this place! The hosts went above and beyond to make us feel so welcome! I let her know it would be late in evening when we arrived and she strung lights along the walking path to guide our way! I'll stay here again someday - Wonderful experience!

Wish we had more time to walk around on the trails surrounding the cabin. Will definitely come back and stay again. Loved the sketch book that guests have shared about their stay. Janet was so kind to let us check in early. Lovely memory

This was an amazing experience. I had last minute plans change due to car troubles and was able to book and stay within an hour! This is a great little cabin with lots of space. Extremely peaceful! I saw a dear on my morning hike in the woods!
This prairie North Dakota girl was pleased!

This is a lovely cozy cabin retreat! Just being there in the quiet, breathing in the fresh forest scent, listening to the birds sing, was so refreshing. We felt a million miles away though just 10 minutes from town. Others noted the few steps outside down to the spa-like bathroom and the ladder up to the loft bed— both touches made this a delightful place to stay. I loved gazing out the window from the loft bed at the bright stars. I loved stepping out of the bathroom to the balcony surrounded by trees. Thank you Janet and Christian for sharing your beautifully crafted cabin with us.
So peaceful and beautiful scenery! Janet was a lovely host and very responsive. Would love to come again!
Amazing location to unwind . No wifi and no tv is a nice perk to disconnect.
Whole new experience and great place to stay!!!

Second time visiting this beautiful location. I ended up having car issues and not being able to leave. The hosts towed me back to my house and really made me feel like I was family. I will be back several more times. Thank you for having me.

Such a great cozy place; the path with the lights to a peaceful spot nestled in the trees. We were lucky that the clouds had cleared for some stargazing. Would absolutely recommend for a place to go to escape the hustle and bustle.

My friend and I booked this place for a little getaway from the city and LOVED it ! Janet and her husband were very friendly and kind. It truly was so beautiful from the drive in to THE BATHROOM ! My friend and I are in love with this airbnb.
Thank you for sharing your space with us! We loved it and will keep this place in mind next time we want a weekend without the kiddo!
Beautiful location and view. Felt like being in the middle of a fairytale. Would highly recommend for a peaceful getaway.
Beautiful and very whimsical, loved the area and how quiet it was! The hosts are very friendly and make you feel at home 🩵

Incredibly peaceful weekend staying in this cabin. Could have laid in bed all day just listening to the rain on the tin roof.
Note: More bed pillows have been added, so no need to bring your own, as other reviewers have mentioned.

Amazing stay, straight out of a fairytale.
Thank you to the owners for this amazing last minute stay!!

The place seemed like it was straight out of a travel magazine, it was a wonderful stay and centrally located.
Some things to note: the bed is in a loft, which is up a ladder. I could see it being precarious for older or larger folks.
Bring your own pillows- we read the reviews that said this and we’re glad we did. The bed and pillows were comfy but we used the extra pillows to cover the two windows that are next to the bed. It was a moonlit night and made the bed very bright.
Other than those things, it was marvelous. And the host was very accommodating. We will definitely be coming back.

This has to be one of our new favorite getaway spots!! Janet and her husband were very friendly and the cabin was breathtaking! My husband and I couldn't get over how peaceful and perfect the cabin was. There are tons of beautiful trails to explore. The loft bed, accessible by a rolling ladder (nice that we could slide it to the side when we didn't need the loft) was beyond soft and we slept amazing. We knew there was no stove so we prepared for microwave cooking, no big deal at all. The deck overlooking the trails below was fun to read a book on while listening to nuthatches talk amongst the branches. The bathroom is a character itself when it greets you with a fresh cedar scent that comes from the shower planks, instantly added some luxury. The 400' walk to the cabin was lovely, lit by little lights. We seriously felt so relaxed and rested after our one night stay. We will be returning in the future, guaranteed!! Book this place if you find an opening, you won't regret it.
Amazing! We will be back!
Worth every penny!
As always loved being there.
Awesome as it always is. Loved my stay. Can’t wait until the next trip!

Great location,last minute getaway from Kent.Same exit as Centralia outlet,so of course we did a little shopping & had lunch @Country Cousin before checking in at 3p.The location is easy to get to.The trail from the parking spot to the cabin can feel long when carrying baggage,but super nice when empty handed.
CABIN.The exterior & interior of cabin looks just like the pictures. It is super important to note,which isn’t stated on the Airbnb description, is that you have to walk outside to use the bathroom downstairs. The walk isn’t bad,but would total suck in the rain.The bathroom is nice, almost spa like & smells “piney”.For those staying a long period of time, you would have to pre-plan meals.I did note the appliances @ the cabin,so I brought my butan stove&pan.We were able to cook steak,salmon & potatoes.The bed was comfy. My husband was glad we brought our own pillows as someone suggested in the reviews.Also,maybe add a coat hook.
LOVED OUR STAY

10/10 Amazing! I was looking for a romantic, secluded cabin for an anniversary weekend. Upon arrival, Janet kindly offered a cart for our luggage. We arrived at sundown and the 1min trail walk to the cabin was lit by string lights. Microwave, toaster, and crockpot is offered so plan your meals. We enjoyed breakfast on the deck, and stargazing at night (even heard some coyotes!) There are tons of deer throughout the area too. The cabin has a comfy couch and blankets, a table perfect for two and playing board games/cards :) The bed is nice but I would bring your own pillows; The bathroom smells amazing (pine) and feels almost like a spa. We spent some time walking through the trails and exploring. Tip: Shoes left outside the cabin helps keep it clean! Connecting with nature was so healing. Reading through the "Cabin Comments" and seeing everyone's stories was so fun. This experience changed our lives and we can't wait to return! Thank you for sharing this space with us! Love from PDX!

This was one of the coolest little places I've ever been to. The property is amazingly beautiful and peaceful. The host was extremely friendly and accommodating and the price was very reasonable. The bathroom was awesome; it was huge and very warm! Great experience!
Everything we wanted and more. The cabin was beautiful and perfect for our quick over night stay!

I cannot recommend this stay enough! Not only were the hosts so friendly and personable, they were also very flexible with a work snafu I had that came up requiring a last minute change to my reservations that was much appreciated. I can tell they are hard working people who just want to make a lovely stay for their guests. The place itself was great and just what I needed to relax. It was very private and in a safe area in the middle of a tree farm and the bed was so comfy. There are plenty of heating and cooling options so temp was always perfect. Small, but everything you need for one-two people comfortably. Do keep in mind to go to the bathroom (an oasis, and it smells so good, like real trees) you must first go outside and downstairs to access it, and also the only way to the bed is through a ladder leading to the loft. Worth it, but something to note I’d you decide to stay in case you struggling with frequent stairs/climbing.
What a gorgeous little cabin in the woods! We couldn’t believe we paid so little for such a fairytale lodging. Our host was kind and welcoming and it’s easy to recommend them to anybody.
Our second time here, as always Janet is a great host and the property is so quiet and peaceful for a weekend getaway.
The perfect getaway! Amazing little cabin! Janet and her husband were welcoming and kind!
Great little cabin, perfect for those looking for privacy and simplicity
Beautiful place. With a gorgeous view. Thank you for having me.
Better than expected, beautiful. We want to stay again!

This cabin was amazing! And Janet was so wonderful, she more than willingly allowed me to decorate it to surprise my brother for his wedding night. She was super helpful and kind. It is a beautiful and clean place to stay!
Great quiet cabin. Beautiful woods to walk around!
It was amazing a great getaway from life.
Was an incredible stay! The hosts were very nice and extremely helpful. The cabin is incredibly peaceful and private with tons of beautiful nature. Would most definitely come back!
This was my 2nd time staying at the little cabin, it’s my favorite Airbnb I’ve booked. It’s secluded in the woods, cozy and has so many trails to explore! Will definitely be coming back again!

It really was a magical place! Janet and Christian were the kindest folks, and the little cabin was just perfect. My partner and I had an amazing time there, just what we needed to unwind and smell the trees, hear the rain, sleep in. I actually really enjoyed the bathroom being where it was; it gives you a little privacy that's unexpected in such close quarters. The bathroom was super comfortable and roomy, and the little deck off the back was delightful. I seldom repeat bookings but I think we will come back to this sweet little cabin!
Such an amazing stay. I will definitely be going back anytime I need to get away from the buzz of the city
Very nice space!

Great little spot! The hosts were super helpful and turned on the lights so it was easy for us to find the path when we arrived late in the evening. The cabin is very private and quiet. We really enjoyed our stay!
Best kept secret in Washington. Very Magical and surreal. Super relax,calm, and peaceful place. Janet is the best! Thank you!

Hands down one of the best places I've ever stayed. I chatted with Christian on my arrival and departure and he was kind, funny, knowledgeable, and really down to earth which made it feel really homey. Other than that, I experienced solitude during my stay, which is what I wanted. Highly recommend Janet and Christian's cabin if you need a break from the world to be alone in nature. It's the perfect place :)
This is a fabulous cabin in the woods. It is quite clean peaceful and the hosts are great!
The most coziest tiny cabin I ever stayed in, filled with wildlife to enjoy. Parking was easy to find and we were well accommodated by the host.

Janet and Christian were wonderful hosts. I mentioned we were there for the meteor shower and when we arrived they had housed their livestock and placed comfortable outdoor chairs in the pasture for us to watch the sky! So thoughtful! The cabin in the forest was a delightful cozy tiny house and the pictures accurately portrayed that. There is a lovely back porch for reading and coffee sipping in the morning. Centralia has a lot of fun activities too. We visited the barcade Insert Coin and the toy store Let’s Play Something. O’blarney’s was great if you like sports pubs.
The Cabin In the Forest is a great place if you are seeking a private stop in the woods or some fun activities in town. It’s perfect if you’re seeking both!

Janets cabin was a wonderful place to stay for 2! So comfortable and beautiful! She and her husband were very friendly, the cabin was very clean, the view from the porch was peaceful, and the bed was very comfortable!

Such a sweet experience-- the cabin is cozy and welcoming, and the surrounding forest and walking trails were such a peaceful addition to fill out my short, solitary stay. Hosts were very sweet and helpful. A beautiful spot!
Janet was a friendly responsive host in her place was amazing! I would definitely go back there completely unplug and relax

Janet and Christian are such lovely people! Their land is beautiful and the cabin is private off to the side down a short path. We loved the bathroom and style of cozy through out the whole cabin. The greenery is gorgeous! We had a rainy day during our stay and it was the patio being covered that made for a relaxing morning with coffee. Recommend going to Judy’s for breakfast. Taking a day to see Mount Rainier and hike. Would stay here again!
Great time in this lovely cabin in the forest , thank you Janet & Christian !
The cabin was awesome!
Janet's cabin in the woods and was as expected. I stayed here one night for the STP ride and was worth the stay for a soft bed and shower post day one of the STP.
Awesome magical place. I really enjoyed the the space they created. Looking forward to book another stay when the dates a available. Truely a Washington secret.
