This was a cute and cozy house. Was perfect for our two night stay. Just wish there was a fire pit out side to enjoy the beautiful nights. Close to the freeway and the downtown area.
Suited all our needs during our stay. Super quiet neighborhood.
great stay and location!
A total gem. This is hands down the best accommodation in the area.
Savannah's cozy tiny home was such a great stay. Place was really clean and had plenty of amenities. If you're looking for a smaller and cozier place to stay then you can't go wrong here.

It's a cute tinyish house, very bright and open. The house was on the cleaner side but honestly could've been cleaner for the price you pay, we found some hair on the pillows (not ours) and anything that was white had stains (rug in living room, and door trim). Driveway does have a big dip in it that a car wouldnt make it over. The decorations and atmosphere were perfect and very cozy, the shower was amazing, location was perfect close to everything and kitechen was beautiful. I did had trouble checking in due to the host not checking messages because I booked less 24 hours in advance and relied on auto messages ( that were never sent) but the host never check to make sure the code sent to check in I contacted 3 times. I would say over all a decent stay but with the cleaning problem I wouldn't stay again.

Great location! Right off of I-5 and just a short drive to downtown.
The space was comfortable and clean. This newly built tiny home doesn't seem tiny at all!
Our only concern was that the ladder to the loft did not have a way to lock in place so it would not be safe for small children or unsteady adults.
Wonderful place to stay, just out of view of town but never more than a few minutes from anything you need! Everything I needed was there!
The place was very clean and private. I enjoyed making my coffee in the morning and enjoying the view. Very close to town and easy to get in and out of. I enjoyed my stay
perfect location.. stayed 5 days...

My friend and I had a quiet and peaceful class which included zoom meetings. We were looking forward to hiking but the weather did not cooperate and we were busier with our class than we thought. Thanks for a beautiful, artistic area for our meditation retreat.

The only regret was that I only had time for an overnight visit. When I return I am hoping for a longer stay. The basement accommodations are charming, to say the least. Downtown Centralia (a few minutes away) needs a bit more exploring too.

I had such a peaceful stay! Gretchen's place was homey, cozy, and comfortable. The home made granola and muffins were such a sweet touch, and her garden was blooming right outside my window. It was beautiful. Thank you!
I had a lovely stay, I felt right at home for the couple days that I was there
A delightfully friendly host and peaceful setting ❤️
Although I could not stay the full time this was a wonderful stay and it was peaceful and beautiful. Thank you Gretchen!

Absolutely loved Gretchen’s place!! I love that you could access trails from her property. The breakfast treats were amazing. The bed is comfy. This is a wonderful find and would definitely stay here again. Great, thoughtful host! We ate at The Branch, highly recommended! Make reservations.

Gretchen’s place is not only comfortable, but also spacious. Very clean, well kempt - with unique decor and heritage furniture. Also - she provides breakfast with homemade granola, applesauce, and muffins:)
Super responsive and clear instructions
Beautiful property that is perfect distance outside of town to create separation but still be close to conduct business or hop back onto the I-5
Highly recommend!
This little gem on the hill was far better than I imagined, more homey than I pictured, and more what I needed than I had even realized. Thank you for a very peaceful, quiet, and relaxing stay.
Gretchen’s was the perfect place for us couple of days exploring and attending a family wedding. It was quiet and peaceful.

This is a lovely and peaceful place to stay when in the Twin Cities.
Gretchen is a gracious host and the home made muffins she provides are yummy.
Nestled in the forest, with a beautiful view, I highly recommend this Airbnb.
Gretchen is a great host.
A few minutes from town with a beautiful view of the valley. Lots of fun, bright playful artwork. The continental breakfast was delicious.
Gretchen is an amazing host! Everything she did+ to make our stay wonderful - was thoughtful, kind and very tasty. We hope to get the chance to stay again!
As always, it's such a pleasure to stay here while I write! Thank you for sharing your lovely place, Gretchen!

A cozy retreat in a beautiful setting. Comfortable, private and quiet with nearby hiking trails. Close to restaurants and shops. Gretchen is a friendly and gracious host. Her homemade muffins and applesauce were a perfect start to the morning.
I will always give 5 stars to my host for opening up their home to me especially when they are as kind as this host. Had a great view and it’s so quiet.

Wow, we were not prepared for how gorgeous Gretchen's place was! Lots of hiking trails and a short drive from the downtown area. We loved the vintage shops in Centralia. With our trip we drove around a lot, we loved how centralized it was on the west side of Washington.
Also, the other reviews didn't lie, her muffins were fantastic. Enjoy your stay with her!

We enjoyed a relaxing weekend at Gretchen's place, tucked away in a forest yet close to town. Self check-in was easy but we did meet Gretchen who is an author and artist as well as an amiable host. The place is decked out in unique art and collectibles and had an ample supply of books and breakfast foods. If you're a light sleeper you may be bothered by the coyotes yipping in the distance at night or the long, lonely horns from trains passing through Centralia, but we loved it. Don't stay in a hotel if you can stay at Gretchen's place instead!
We totally enjoyed this peaceful place! it was a very relaxing stay. Gretchen was very helpful and friendly. We would stay again in a heartbeat!
We have stayed several times, and hope to stay again. The patio is a place I can go in my mind to find peace and quiet. ❤️
Quiet and relaxing
We had a lovely time at”Earth of Three Farm”. The muffins were delicious, the bed was super comfortable and the view was amazing. I would definitely stay here again.

In the week stay the temperature during the day was in the 90’s and 2 days over 100. The place was cool and comfortable day and night. And the homemade muffins and yogurt were delicious. Gretchen was a wonderful, friendly host.

This place is truly a hidden gem in Centralia! Gretchen's hospitality and baked goods were delicious, and we had a great time exploring the nearby forest and shops (highly recommend Vicky's El Salvadorian food)!
The place is a convenient 1-2hr drive from St Helens and Rainier, both beautiful hiking areas.
Only con we noticed was some ambient noise (e.g., a freight train horn). But we otherwise had a peaceful and enjoyable stay!
Great communication. Beautiful setting. Would not hesitate coming back!
A very beautiful and quiet setting. I loved the home made touches and unique decorations. I would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here for STP, very nice private location that’s up the hill away from all the train noise downtown. Gretchen is a great host, providing a delicious muffin and yogurt for breakfast in the morning and is responsive to messages. If you need a break from the big city, a weekend stay here is a good refresher 👍

All the praises and great responses you see here and other posts are accurate. This is what Airbnb was supposed to be about and she is the epitome of that. My words simply can’t do justice to what a wonderful place Gretchen has.
Wonderful place to unplug. Very quiet and serene. Continental breakfast a welcome bonus.

Quiet, secluded, peaceful getaway. Lovely mid century modern home artistically appointed. There was something that made me smile at every turn. Loved all the little whimsy all over the property. Loved sitting on the patio for coffee in the morning and in the evening after supper listening to the birds singing. Loved the view of Mt Adams and the ancient trees surrounding the house. Took a small hike into the nature area. Beautiful wilderness full of huge trees and tons of ferns. We absolutely loved our stay here and honestly hated to leave. Would come back in a heartbeat 💓

Im glad i chose Gretchen's place out of all that was available. It was just outside of town, peaceful and comfortable. I spent most of my time during the day with my family, came back to relax for a bit and then go to sleep. So it was perfect!
As usual, Gretchen's property was exactly what I needed. Perfect, beautiful, quiet, comfortable. the perfect hidden gem in Chehalis

Gretchen’s place was a treat mainly because of the beautiful surroundings! The space was so peaceful, largely in part due to the patio, trails, and access to the garden. Inside was cozy and welcoming.

3 of Earth Farm’s special significance to Gretchen and her family is impossible to miss while staying there. Clearly willing to invite guests into their world, Gretchen’s book, “Mother Lode,” as well as the history of the location, are shared openly. The best part of the location are the trails leading directly into the Seminary Hill Natural Area, established in thanks to the effort’s of Gretchen’s family.
My daughter loved the hand made granola, exploring the forest, and playing frisbee in the meadow. Rustic and uniquely decorated, 3 of Earth is welcoming, and Gretchen was very accessible and communicative.

Very rustic setting with a beautiful view of Mount St. Helens on a clear day. Even though it was hot and sunny outside over the weekend, there was A/C inside and with the breeze and shade in the basement unit, it was quite pleasant. Gretchen had a lot of her photographs and art work displayed which made it quite pleasant. I made the mistake of thinking that there was a sink in the kitchenette set up, so that was a small hiccup for me to cook an entire meal! Other than that, given that Gretchen provided yummy muffins, coffee/tea, yogurt for breakfast, and it was close enough to Centralia, we will eat out next time! Very peaceful surroundings and Gretchen is very communicative - great host.
was only in town for a few days and this place was perfect! the view was amazing and the space felt so at home! so many books / magazines / pictures from all of washington. loved it would stay again
Very peaceful and relaxing.
Beautiful retreat perfect for my needs.
Loved Gretchen’s place. Everything was just as she said in her listing. The price was awesome. Honestly I think she should charge more. I highly recommend a stay here.
Eclectic and quiet space. Loved the homey touches, especially the muffins. :)

This was my second visit at Three of Earth Farm. Gretchen provides a retreat nestled in the peaceful countryside. She ensures easy access to property by effective and timely communication. She ensures comfort by providing thoughtful and unique touches throughout the suite. Adding to the experience was a wandering deer visiting in the morning, sweet birds sharing their music and a furry little guy burrowing under the sidewalk.
Thank you once again Gretchen, we had a wonderful time.

Gretchen’s place was such a sweet, warm, quiet, and comforting space. We enjoyed the beautiful trails, watching the wild birds and deer nearby, admiring her photography, writing, and artwork, sipping on hot tea, and enjoying scrumptious muffins and homemade vegan granola with yogurt. We felt right at home and loved all the personal touches and vibrant colors of the rooms and decor. My husband works nights so he really appreciated how dark the room was with the blinds and how cozy the bed was. Gretchen was very easy and friendly to communicate with and we highly recommend this well-preserved, quaint and peaceful retreat.
If you need a quiet getaway in the woods, stay here. Just a lovely place with a lovely host.

The main reason why I booked Gretchen's guest house is because of the price.
I was planning to stay in a hotel for 2 nights in Chehalis, after looking at prices, the hotels in town would cost me $400 for 2 nights. I was in town to see friends, and I was not planning on spending much time in a hotel room. Gretchen's guest house cost me $190 total for 2 nights. Gretchen's directions to the property were easy to follow. I had to drive my Ford F150 pickup truck on this trip, I was not aware of how narrow the driveway is, and I was worried my truck was not going to fit. Turns out, there was plenty of room to maneuver my truck. The guest house was exactly what I needed. The bed was super comfortable. Gretchen provided some vegan granola, yogurt & and muffins, which I totally ate and were delicious. Inside the guest house is super cute. Lots of artwork and books. I enjoyed the patio in the evening and listened to the frogs. FYI, there's not a TV. so plan for that and bring a tablet. 10/10 ⭐️

We had a great time at Gretchen's place. It was very cozy and had some amazing views. I really loved how we could walk to a wide array of hiking trails just from the backyard. The property is really beautiful and it's the perfect spot for a peaceful getaway. We really apreciated the thoughtful touches such as the muffins and granola. One of the best Airbnb's I've been to yet. We look forward to returning the next time we need a reset in nature!

You’ll love this space. Gretchen’s place is very livable and you’ll feel like you’re home. She helped me with so many other personal requests, which made me feel safe and thoroughly accommodated. You won’t regret your stay here
Gretchen's place was awesome! The location was beautiful, and she went out of her way to pick us up and drop us off at the train station. I highly recommend to anyone in the area.

I was thrilled with Gretchen's place. All I needed and then some was provided. Everywhere I looked (over seven days!) I would see another whimsical piece of art, or soul enriching book, or a new amazing view out the window. A magical place I am almost reluctant to share so effusively about out of shear selfishness!

This stay was amazing! The decor of the place is beautiful and the atmosphere was cozy and warm! The view from the living room and bedroom of the suite is gorgeous. The breakfast was really good and it was overall a very quiet and pleasant experience.

Visited this Airbnb for a few nights to do a solo songwriting retreat. It was peaceful, not too far from town, and had everything I needed. Great for birdwatching (bring your binoculars), lots of books and magazines, really comfy bed with an excellent view. There was plenty of coffee and tea, and even fresh muffins. Yum! Hope to visit again! Thank you :)
Ferns, trees, birds, view of a peaceful valley. Whimsical décor. Sit in an armchair and take in the view. If you need a retreat, here's the spot.
Great place to unplug. Fabulous hiking attached. Perfectly suited my needs.

I look forward to returning to Gretchen’s place during warmer weather. The location is great, but the rain and snow made for tricky steps from parking down to the front door. The decor is artsy and creative and the apartment was very well appointed.

One of the best Airbnb’s I’ve stayed in. It is conveniently located between Portland and Seattle. Gretchen’s place has beautiful views and is perfect for a peaceful getaway to be away from the City life. It is extremely spacious and Gretchen made sure everything was clean and tidy. She is also super responsive and great communicator. I’m definitely coming back sometime in the summer!
Gretchen was great! Quick response, accommodating. Very cozy place. Amazing scenery and relaxing environment. Thank you.

Such a beautiful oasis hidden back away from the road! We LOVED the privacy, quiet, nature (birds, deer, vegetation), and peace of Gretchen’s place. The interior of her place is even more impressive in person and the view of the valley below outside is spectacular if it’s not covered by mist. It was the perfect place to spend a few days while visiting family and friends who lived in the area. We definitely recommend staying here and will try to book again when we’re in the area.
Beautiful view, cozy atmosphere and all the comforts of home away from home. I will definitely be back!

What a great place stay! The place was exactly what I wanted for my visit to Centralia. It is a cozy place close to town with everything you need. I will definitely be back again, hopefully for a longer time so I can fully enjoy the property and trails nearby.
Gretchen's guest suite is very comfortable and well apportioned, and her lovely house is in a beautiful location! I would happily stay here again!
Just wonderful! Everything was lovely:) we enjoyed our quick getaway at her quaint home.
charming place to stay with all the amenities needed!

Highly recommended. A beautiful, peaceful respite near a vibrant downtown. Centralia is packed with antique stores, shops and restaurants. We enjoyed the bustle during the day and quiet mornings and evenings at Gretchen's home. The continental breakfast was terrific. Very private. Trails nearby. Couldn't have asked for a better place to meet up with a friend for a weekend.

Gretchen's place is such a gem! Got to stay for a whole week and I had the most wonderful time. I unfortunately had to work and study during my stay, but the internet was fast and the scenery more than made up for my lack of free time. Gorgeous views of the valley and trees and, if the weather is favorable, a stunning view of St Helens (for the best view, walk a little way back along the path leading from the patio at dusk and dawn). The apartment is bright and cheerful and there are so many thoughtful touches. The space had everything I needed and then some - comfy furniture, lots of space, a small kitchen (with everything required to make simple meals), and delicious breakfast treats and coffee. My favorite thing may have been the adjacent Seminary Hill Natural Area. I walked the trails every day and it felt like I had the entire forest to myself. Thanks again for sharing your magical home, Gretchen!
clean, comfy, and a cute place to stay! I'd stay again!
3 of Earthfarm has a great view, a wonderful homemade continental breakfast, a comfortable bed, and if you come at the right time , the moon shines on your bed for about 4 hours.
Wonderful location- quiet and peaceful. Host is very quick to communicate and lots of great personal touches.
Clean place in an amazing location. Peacefull and quiet but still close to restaurants, stores, etc. The breakfast and coffee were very nice touches. Recommended

Gretchen's home, grounds, and views are so lovely and welcoming. We had visits from the deer each morning as we breakfasted on the secluded patio overlooking the rural valley below. We thoroughly enjoyed the homemade granola and yummy applesauce that first morning. We've order Gretchen's forthcoming book (Oct. 2022) "Mother Lode" and look forward to learning more about her return to the Pacific NW after living 36 years in the Southeastern U.S.

Our stay with Gretchen was wonderful! A quiet, spacious place, decorated with cheerful colors, filled with whimsical art, and over looking a valley from its perch on Seminary Hill awaits you! A family feeling permeates the place as you view Gretchen’s photographs of nature
that includes surrounding wooded paths. Seminary Hill park is very close by and offers beautiful forest trails to hike. This is a haven of peace to springboard your journey. Highly recommended.
An amazing. clean place with great views and homemade muffins and granola for breakfast.

Gretchen is a great host! The accommodations were just what we were looking for and just as described. It is a beautiful house with lovely surrounding gardens and forest. Absolutely a retreat from the hustle and bustle of town and city!
Cozy and colorful space with a great view and a tasty complimentary breakfast.

I absolutely enjoyed every minute I was at Gretchen’s. Peaceful yet close to Centralia, I only regret that I was so busy with friends and family that I could not just spend a day soaking up the peace and beauty. I will be back

This stay was one our favorites to date. We do a lot of airbnb's, and this one is just so special. Especially for the nature lover and those that appreciate peace and quiet. Special touches like the homemade applesauce, muffins and granola just sent it over that perfect 10 mark. I personally loved all the beautiful books she has and so many about the mountains we visited. I think Gretchen is very special and selfless to share her beautiful home with people. Thank you so much for your beautiful heart!

What an incredible oasis in the heart of Centralia! Gretchen's private guest suite felt like home away from home: from the homemade applesauce & granola that awaited us to the beautiful collection of books & eclectic photos all around, this place was truly fairyland come to life! Gretchen even went the extra mile (quite literally) by offering to drive us to nearby Centralia College when we couldn't find a ride share in the early morning hours for the Seattle to Portland ride. A whimsical retreat coupled with 100% genuine hospitality. We can't wait to stay again during our next Washington visit!

Exceeded expectations. Beautiful and spacious. The decor and little whimsical touches made me want to stay forever. And the view! Watched the moonrise from the very comfortable bed. Upon arrival, we found a fresh pitcher of filtered water, homemade muffins and apple sauce waiting for us, and a nice welcome note. Other little touches are too numerous to list, but the high quality bedding, robe, and writing utensils and space are just a few. This space is quiet and serene, just what we needed. Great location. Best Airbnb I’ve visited. Gretchen was super responsive and left clear directions. Great value too!
Great spot and home base for St. Helens and Ranier

What a great place! I loved my stay at Gretchen's peaceful gem. It was just what I needed to reconnect with myself and nature. My favorite thing was sitting and looking over the valley or into the trees and just soaking in the sounds and sights. It filled me up. It is also really comfortable, peaceful and well laid out. The bed and oversized chair were so plush and the muffins and granola so delicious! Thank you, Gretchen, for sharing your little pocket of peace with me!

Lovely place to stay. Very spacious and extremely comfortable. Everything works great and although there is no full kitchen we found it easy to prepare simple meals. Great location as only 5 mins from I5 yet incredibly peaceful. Gretchen is a wonderful host.
This is our second stay at Gretchen’s wonderful place. Such a nice peaceful stay.
Wonderful host!

The first impression of walking through the entrance is that you are stepping into a Pedro Almodóvar inspired space: harmony based on simplicity and a symphony of bold colors. It is thoughtfully designed and artistic. The room is complementary to the breathtaking scenery. Gretchen placed freshly picked “forget-me-not” flowers next to our bed which was very touching and definitely unforgettable. Combined with utmost care, cleanliness, and heartwarming hospitality we had the perfect get away experience. Highly recommended!
Such a great stay!! :) everything was absolutely perfect! Location was fantastic. We’d absolutely stay here again.

Gretchen’s place is amazing! Quiet and absolutely beautiful. We stayed 2 nights, and I was amazed that we were still finding little “happies” when we were packing up.
Thanks for such a great stay!

A charming place that makes it easy to relax, unwind and enjoy the beautiful views and surroundings. The unit is a creatively decorated one bedroom, very suitable for a single or a couple looking for a unique setting. Nothing corporate cookie cutter about Gretchen's place! And that is a good thing if you are open to a place that is an artistic expression (and a tasteful and whimsical one that at) of Gretchen's love of the outdoors. Found it refreshing to be somewhere with a tv and lots of electronics. There was adequate wifi and I did bring a small cd player for music. Even though the unit is on the lower level of a house (with separate entrance) there was lots of privacy and Gretchen was not an intrusive host. The place is only a mile from downtown Centralia, but it seems to be a whole way. Thanks Gretchen for making this such a pleasant stay!
This is a lovely place that is everything promised and more!
I passed on an evening meeting to get back to walk the trails and watch the valley below. Great place to chill. On my list of places to stay again.

This was such a nice place and a beautiful location. We stayed here to ride in the Cascadia Super G gravel bike race.
Centralia is a really cool little town and we'll definitely visit again. There's a lot of great restaurants, historic buildings, and fun shops on the main strip.
There's also a bird sanctuary on a short walk through the woods that was quite enjoyable.
I'm pretty sure the birds love this place as much as I do. Everything was perfect, from the delicious breakfast to the cozy space, to the morning birdsong seranade. Always five star ☆☆☆☆☆

This was my first stay at an Airbnb. Gretchen was wonderful to answer all my questions and ease my concerns before I made my reservation. Three of Earth Farm was a great choice. I had a wonderful 5-day stay, a sort of mini-retreat.
Some of the highlights:
* Sitting on the private patio and seeing eagles, hawks and vultures soar overhead
* Really enjoying the sense of space being above things by seeing the valley below, the hills in the distance... and Mt. St. Helens!
* Spending time every day in the Seminary Hill Natural Area - accessed by a great trail right from the property. Magnificent trees and woods, lush green colors, wonderful trails (some more challenging than others), beautiful sounds (especially all the different birds), benches along the way and more.
* Enjoying Gretchen's healthy, thoughtful and delicious breakfasts: homemade granola, applesauce and muffins with fresh yogurt. Yum! Plus, having a small kitchenette was great for meal flexibility.
* And so much more!
Gretchen's photos and descriptions on the Airbnb page do a great job giving an accurate sense of the place.
There were a few things that surprised me a bit. I share these with the hope I can help others not be surprised. There was a little musty smell when I walked in. After a few hours I didn't notice it anymore. I'm sensitive to noises and the place was noisier than I expected: trains in the valley randomly day and night, some road/highway noise in the valley, cattle mooing into the night (sometimes waking me up), the fridge and space heaters were pretty noisy. The place was colder than I expected. None of these things were bad and I adjusted to them.
Thank you, Gretchen, for a wonderful experience!

Gretchen’s home is a real gem. It is so peaceful & comfortable. She fulfills her desire to put the ‘B’ in AirB&B wonderfully with her special homemade treats. Communication was always good. Wish I could have stayed longer.

This was a great spot! It was cozy and awesome after a long day out on the trails. Gretchen was a great communicator throughout our trip and was very helpful:) She even included a complimentary breakfast of yogurt, homemade granola, apple sauce and homemade muffins, I’d come back for the breakfast alone!

What a lovely hideaway, above the bustle of town, but close enough to get out and about easily. The rooms were filled with lovely furniture, charming art pieces, photos, plenty of books on the region, nature, art, and more. The breakfast was delightful, and made it so we could get out early for our adventures. Everything we needed for our short stay. And the view was stunning. Thanks for arranging those sunsets and sunrises!!

We loved staying at this whimsical place. The view outside the window is gorgeous. Gretchen left delicious muffins, yogurt, granola and applesauce for our breakfast. We would definitely stay here again!
Gretchen’s place is beautiful; wildlife abounds!

Wish we could've have stayed longer! The location, view, décor, continental breakfast - all wonderful! So much color and art inside, and even more to see outside as well with a valley view, private patio, and grounds to explore. Great directions, easy check in, responsive host. This is easily one of my top airbnb faves!

What a lovely little gem!!! The location is perfect …just a short drive away from town. This little suite is a quiet little place with a beautiful view of the valley. Easy to find and very easy check in. The space is very colorful and neatly furnished. Gretchen is a very thoughtful and caring host!!! She took the time to create a cozy environment with many personal touches. I enjoyed the fun colors and all the art so tastefully arranged to make the place warm and welcoming. I worked at night and got home in the morning just in time to watch the sunrise. It was soooo quiet and peaceful. The bed was also comfy and had very soft bedding! The outside patio and garden area are very nicely set up. Good place to relax and read or just enjoy nature. I enjoyed the birds and the faint sound of chimes outside the window. The breakfast was amazing! Couldn’t ask for more! The homemade granola, muffins and yogurt were something to look forward to :). The kitchenette had everything one needs to cook simple meals. I had a very good experience and had everything I needed. I loved every minute of my stay!! Thank you for being a wonderful hostess of such a cozy little place!

This is a beautiful stay in the lower level of a home, with a gorgeous view from every room. There are spaces to read, to lounge, to write, and to create art. The homemade granola and muffins provided made for a perfect morning snack. The kitchenette (hot plate, microwave, refrigerator) was just enough to make simple meals, and Gretchen provided a dish tub for doing the dishes. There were lovely trails to walk, and birds to watch every morning. Gretchen was communicative, and it was very obvious how much she cared about our experience.

What a wonderful experience! This is quite possibly my favorite AirBnb I’ve visited. A previous review called it a “balm for the soul” and I couldn’t agree more. Gretchen was so kind and considerate in every aspect of my stay. The space itself is absolutely delightful, cozy, and full of thoughtful touches. The natural beauty on/around the property cannot be overstated— getting to watch the fog roll through the valley was just magic. Not to mention the continental breakfast! Oh my word. I left feeling nourished, inspired, and well rested. Thank you Gretchen, and I hope to come visit again soon!

This place is a home away from home! My husband and I spent a few nights here and it was so comforting. We couldn’t have asked for a better place! Gretchen thought out every detail of the place and the colors are so fun! The second you step in you feel like you can relax and just be in that space. It’s so in tune with nature, and I was able to see a hummingbird for the first time just hanging out by the garden. We were also able to see some deer and wake up to the birds singing in the morning. If you need a space to reset and feel like you’re connected to the environment around you, definitely take a chance and stay here!

Five star stay ! Honestly, I love this airbnb. Gretchen has planned for every need and the breakfast part of this beautiful place is beyond compare. Those muffins (swoon) ... Seriously amazing. Clean, cozy and a visual delight. Can't wait to return !

Really special one-of-a-kind place! Fully furnished with many personal touches. You can tell how much Gretchen loves this place and is so generous to share it with guests! Wish I had more time to enjoy it.

A perfect place to stay and a great location! Outside city limits where it was quiet, serene, peaceful and absolutely gorgeous sunrises right outside our door/window! Gretchen was so quick to offer suggestions when asked and very prompt with any questions we had! A great host!
A great place to stay. Beautiful views and cozy area and very clean. We give it 5 stars!

We needed a home base between Olympic and Rainier National Parks and Gretchen's place in Centralia was perfect. The town is a bit small for our taste but there were plenty of bars and restaurants in neighboring cities like Olympia. Gretchen's apartment is very artsy, and full of color and little trinkets to enjoy. Since we stayed for five nights we were so glad to have the mini kitchenette with the hot plate, fridge and more. Bring your own shampoo and conditioner but she has literally everything else for you. The internet is pretty good too. My partner and I were both on video calls for work and it was mostly great. Download speeds are slow but we only needed to download large files a couple times. Gretchen was so sweet and replied to messages quickly. Easy check in and check out. Thanks!

Comfortable, thoughtfully and carefully put together guest suite. The host clearly cares about her place. Nice outdoor hanging-out with a view, when the weather is nice. Gretchen is communicative and easy to interact with.

Gretchens place is the perfect location if you are planning on exploring the Mt St Helens region! Not only did the unit have amazing views of the valley, it was in a beautiful and tranquil setting. Gretchen is a very attentive host and a great baker! She provided us with awesome treats.
Beautiful location. Close to many different activities. Relaxing retreat.
A beautiful place, and such care Gretchen expresses through her attention to detail. I lacked for nothing, and received all I needed.

Gretchen is a superb host. Her place is warm and comfortable and in the most perfect natural setting. There is nothing not to enjoy. Make a visit there to enjoy the tranquility and the beauty of the surroundings by hiking on Seminary Hill.

Gretchen is a great host and wonderful person and we enjoyed talking with her. Her place is immaculate and has neat little artistic touches everywhere. She leaves homemade granola and muffins and yogurt -very good. The outside patio and garden area are gorgeous and we saw some deer one morning. Her whole property is beautiful with a great view of the valley below. There is a fun walk in the Seminary Hill woods right from her yard. All in all- a great place.
Gretchen was great at communicating and very helpful with planing our stay. Check in and check out was easy. The only improvement suggested would be a larger bed.
Gretchen has a beautiful place here, she was more than willing to answer questions and go the extra mile for us, will be back for sure!

I stayed with Gretchen for the second time. Her place is cozy and quiet with peaceful surroundings and beautiful views. Perfect place to retreat after a long day or for some writing/creative time. Plus tasty muffins and granola/yogurt for breakfast! Thank you Gretchen!

Gretchen's place is magical! It's a cozy place to get away from the city and enjoy nature, whether from outside or admiring the views from inside. Gretchen has thought of everything we could have needed and more, and messaged us to make sure our stay was perfect. My husband and I highly recommend this airbnb!

Gretchen's place is a peaceful haven with hiking trails that start on the property, lots of personal touches including great books to read and a yummy breakfast including homemade granola. Gretchen is the most generous and welcoming host!

This is by far one of the best Airbnb’s in the country. We have traveled to many places and we were floored with views, hospitality, and location! You will not regret staying here as Gretchen goes above and beyond for her guests! Make sure to do as many of the things she recommends as possible, eat the muffins, write in her book, and enjoy the incredible views! This is truly an exceptional place to stay. We were legit sad to come home.

Don't hesitate to book this sweet, magical place - If you're looking to decompress, nothing could be more perfect! Gretchen is an attentive, thoughtful host who has obviously put both love and care into every detail she can think of for her guests. Others have listed them, so I'll just say it was delightful and made me happy each day to wake up and go to sleep each of the 4 days/nights I was there!
this was one of the most peaceful and relaxing places i’ve stayed- if you like PCNW nature and art, you will LOVE this walk out apartment with an idyllic view!

Gretchen’s place is a nice little getaway tucked on top of a hill with beautiful views right from the window. Very well equipped, just as described and less than 5 min drive to town center. Gretchen is a gracious host and has taken care of everything you may need; have to mention the delicious muffins :) There are trails steps from her place and are a joy to explore, wish we’d more time to do that.

Gretchen’s place is one of the best Air BnB’s I’ve ever stayed at. It’s incredibly comfortable (including the furniture…and the bed!! The bed!! 🙌🏾), attractive, super clean, and very private. I absolutely love taking a quiet personal retreat there. There is so much to do right outside the door too…so if you don’t want to drive after you arrive, you can hike, walk, sit in the garden or meadow, or relax on the patio. And the views are sublime. Seriously, if I could, I’d MOVE into this place. Gretchen is also a wonderful host…communicative, helpful if needed, friendly, and private. And her muffins and granola are to die.for. I really cannot recommend her place highly enough.

Gretchen's one-bedroom apartment is artistic, cozy, clean, and comfortable -- a home away from home! There is a nice view of Mt. St. Helens, and a nice garden. The location is closer to Mt. St. Helens (90 min), but two hours drive to the Mt. Rainier National Park. The village of Centralia is historic and nice, with shops, grocery stores, and restaurants. My daughter and I have really enjoyed our 4-day stay there! I would highly recommend it to anyone! Gretchen is very responsive to our requests, kindly made muffins /breakfast, and shared her tips for sightseeing. Many thanks, Gretchen for kindly sharing your warm home!

I booked a 6 night stay at Gretchen’s for Karla, a Boston friend; following is her review, which makes me hope I’ll some day get to enjoy an extended stay there too:
Three of Earth Farm is balm for the soul. Gretchen has created a peaceful, private, spacious and sparkling clean, nest-like retreat. The bed is supportive and comfortable with a view of Mt Rainier, (on a sunny day), and the bed linens are as smooth and soft as silk. Gretchen has thought of every last detail in creating her space to be as functional and convenient as possible; including a first aid kit and umbrella! She has a wonderful library of maps and trail guides/books as well as books about the PNW and nature in general. Plus, the hiking trailhead for Seminary Hill Natural Area is literally steps from your door. Gretchen is also super knowledgeable about exploring and hiking in these forests. 10 Stars!
Karla

Place is clean and so close to the town and where our VB venue was. It had all the primary needs.
Gretchen is a great host and made sure we had all the things we needed, super thoughtful home made goodiesfor breakfast were a hit!! Highly recommend.

Cozy, cozy, cozy! It's about a three-minute drive from Tower Street, the main drag in lovely old Centralia. Gretchen knows all the hikes on Mount St. Helens and answered all of my questions almost immediately. I wanted to see the mountain go pink at sunset from the back yard but I was too tuckered from hiking. It had everything I needed for a weekend away on my own :)

Gretchen’s suite is fantastic. It’s secluded and so incredibly peaceful. You’re very close to downtown Centralia for exploring. The muffins, yogurt, and granola were a lovely surprise and oh so delicious! My only regret is not spending more time there exploring.
Fantastic little gem with dynamite view. Breakfast provided was excellent, lots of room, very cozy. Would stay again!
so accommodating and so beautiful!! can't wait 2 visit again.

Gretchen's place was peaceful, cozy, clean, and had everything I needed (plus delicious homemade muffins!) after some very long days. The location is gorgeous and the pictures don't do it justice. I wish I had more time to explore the woodland trails but I hope to be back the next time I'm in the area.
Very nice place with a unique touch. Will stay here again.

Gretchen's space is a peaceful retreat. Gretchen is an incredibly hospitable host taking great care in providing personalized recommendations and delicious homemade treats that give the space the extra special touch.
This place is so homey, with some many personal touches which make the stay even more magical!
So much bliss in this lovely place. Thank you for another wonderful mini-retreat and all the thoughtful touches.

Gretchen is an angel on earth. The place was a perfect home away from home. Her property is basically situated on top of a nature preserve with many trails, interesting history, and variety of animals, plants and old trees. One wall of the space including the bedroom is all windows letting natural light pour in. A doe and her two babies were living on the property and two mornings in a row I woke up to find them foraging through the huge window within feet of where I was laying. She stocked the place with delicious homemade granola, muffins, and a honey/lemon spread along with fresh yogurt. Do yourself a favor and stay here!
Gretchen is super friendly and her breakfast was amazing. The garden is beautiful and the fire pit was an added bonus to this unique space.

This place is truly balm to the soul. Five-star everything ! Thanks to the birds and the wild landscape, it hits every sensory note and feels like a private wonderland. I will always remember my time here.

We absolutely loved our stay at Gretchen's place! It was the perfect central location for exploring the national parks we were interested in. The space was large and inviting with so many thoughtful touches. Gretchen was incredibly easy to communicate with and she made the most delightful muffins, granola and applesauce. It was such a treat! She also took great care to make sure everything was sanitized and clean and we felt very safe.
Sadly, we didn't get a chance to meet Gretchen in person but we'll definitely stay here again on the next PNW trip!

My stay at 3 of Earth Farm was everything I had hoped for, and more. I took a week for quiet, reflective self retreat and couldn’t have chosen a better place to do so. The living space itself is welcoming, spacious, comfortable, and has a warm, loving vibe. The location is superb for one who appreciates peace and nature. A view from your window and baby deer on your porch!
I felt blessed to be able to walk the miles of trails of the beautiful forested natural area in the literal backyard. You can feel the dedication and appreciation that has preserved and grown the forested area over the years and let the healing power of nature soak into your bones.
As a host Gretchen was simply wonderful. She made my stay exactly what I hoped it would be, a quiet, comforting, healing time. I think even if you stayed just a night you’d leave 3 of Earth Farm feeling better than when you arrived, but better yet to stay at least a few.

Gretchen's guest suite is absolutely beautiful, I could not have asked for a better blessing during a stressful trip. Her beautiful property is literally a breath of fresh air, serenity at its finest. I am so grateful for her hospitality. Also, the muffins were fantastic!

We had the best stay at Gretchen's place...the setting is absolute heaven with a spectacular view. We brought firewood & enjoyed relaxing at the firepit. Hiked the woody trails just outside our door & then went to town for some shopping. So quick to get there & found some great treasures.
The suite was bigger than expected & decorated with so much artsy detail. Bed was super comfy & we loved all the little extra touches you don't normally get at other Air B & Bs. Highly recommend this enchanting little retreat!!

I recently learned that in the hour just before dawn, birds sing to announce they have made it safely through another night. Every morning of my stay I heard this joyous noise. That would have been enough. But there are also mountain views, trails through the woods, a cozy bed, a beautifully decorated suite and the best homemade breakfast around. I'm a return guest, many times over, and I am already looking forward to my next trip. Thank you, Gretchen.
Beautiful view, excellent communications, and homemade goodies waiting for us in the apartment!
It was wonderful. I cannot put it into words.
Another great visit with Gretchen. If I could give 10 stars for value, I would--the suite is spacious, the views are stunning, and the price is amazing.
I would highly recommended Gretchen's place. It's very relaxing with patio chairs to sit and enjoy the view of the valley below.

Gretchen's space was located perfectly adjacent to a large forested park. It had all the right amenities and I loved the colorful creativity throughout the huge apartment. It felt like home, but with a beautiful view, and definitely a great deal.
A sweet, cozy place with lots of character, in a beautiful country setting.
Very comfortable, clean and private. Beautiful view of the Chehalis Valley from the hilltop. Coffee and breakfast in the morning!

I absolutely loved my stay at Gretchen’s beautiful place. The apt is just adorable; sparkling clean, has great water pressure and excellent WiFi. The bed is so comfy and I slept great during my week stay. As an added bonus Gretchen stocks the kitchenette with amazing homemade breakfast items and delicious coffee. What more could you ask for?!? I would definitely stay here again next time I’m in Centralia :)
My stay at Gretchen's place was great! All the pictures and descriptions are spot on. If you can book some time here, I give it my highest recommendation!

If you are in the area, definitely plan a stay at Gretchen's beautiful farm! Upon arriving, you immediately feel peace and joy. Take time to look through her books in the space, the photos on the walls and the cute and whimsical decorations. Next time I'm passing through, I'm hoping to stay for more than just one night!
This place is so cute! Super relaxing and the view out back is beautiful. Tucked away in the trees for the best little weekend getaway!

This place is peaceful, full of lovely and creative touches and has a wonderful view. We choose not to do much in the area because it was cold, windy, and rainy but this was a great spot to spend time relaxing for many hours. The double bed is also extremely comfortable. The breakfast good is a real treat! A great place to stay!
Very cute place. Super cozy. Would stay again for sure.
Gretchen offers a cozy retreat in a quiet and relaxing environment.

My daughter and I stayed at Gretchen's place and it was perfect. The space is beautifully decorated with many artistic touches, great reading material and the most comfortable bed. Gretchen is a great host- very communicative and welcoming. We didn't want to leave, as it felt like home. Also, her place is secluded and quiet, but just minutes from city center. We highly recommend her place!
Awesome place. Great view, nice art all over, cozy & warm. Breakfast muffins are great. Country setting but close to town. Gretchen is a lovely person. Highly recomend.

Three of Earth was such a tranquil retreat and was exactly what was needed to slow an extraordinarily busy life to a pace in tune with nature. Couldn’t recommend the stay enough, Gretchen is a rare soul who made it more than just a place to rest your head, so beautiful.
Very cute, clean, and comfy. The view in the morning was amazing.
Great, clean place. Would stay here again
Our stay was great, Gretchen was very quick to respond and the communication was great! This space is very unique, and it’s surrounded by a very pretty area. We would absolutely stay here again.
Fantastic place - eclectic charm galore. Gretchen is a perfect hostess and the location was great.
Very nice and quiet space. Gretchen has special welcoming touches. Would love to stay again!

Whether you are passing through Centralia and need a restful break in your travels, or are looking for an escape to a peaceful destination, you cannot do better than Three of Earth Farm. The bnb is one of our very favorites ever, and Gretchen is an exemplary host. The location is stunning. Sip your coffee on the patio as dawn brightens the sky over Mount St. Helens, and birds call through the mists. Wander through the bnb, marveling at the many, amazingly artistic touches. I never had the feeling that it was decorated with castoffs, but instead with thoughtful pieces of beauty, many of them functional. Do yourself a favor and book this place. It is food for the soul. We certainly will visit again, and next time it may even be the destination, rather than simply a stopover.
One of the nicest places I've stayed. I wish I had more time here. Highlights were the delicious breakfast, firepit and seeing beautiful deer in the meadow. I want to live here 😍
This little haven is peaceful and relaxing and minutes from downtown. The perfect place to stay in Centralia!

Gretchen's suite probably tops our list of all the airbnbs we have stayed in. It is super clean, stylish, and has a definite retreat/spiritual dimension to it. Gretchen is also a wonderful person who we are so glad to have met.

My wife and I stayed at Gretchen’s place for a night while attending a wedding in Centralia. The farm house is located in an absolutely beautiful location and has some great views. We were very comfortable and enjoyed all of Gretchen’s personal touches including a delicious continental breakfast! Highly recommended.

This little gem is what airbnb was made for. It’s such a nice little place with so much thought spent on ever little detail. Outstanding breakfast and one of the best sleeps of my life. We hope to come back soon.

My husband and I had a wonderful stay here. Cheerful and friendly, Gretchen welcomed us with a hug and gave us tips about the area. The granola, applesauce, and muffins were all homemade, definitely a notch above the usual fare as well as delicious. I enjoyed the artistic touches; it was like a treasure hunt to me to see what Gretchen tucked in somewhere next. Not to be missed is the gorgeous scenery, wildlife, and a lovely view of Mt. St. Helens . It would definitely be a joy to stay here again.
Such a great home! Gretchen's homemade goods were amazing.
If you want solitude, great hospitality, and a gorgeous view, this is the place. The homemade muffins and applesauce just add to the ambience.
Gretchen’s place is the perfect getaway from the city. Not too far, with all of the amenities of home, and peaceful and relaxing as well. We has a wonderful time!
Beautiful peaceful space, comfortable bed, and delicious breakfast
Can use note to Gretchen. 😊
Beautiful piece of serenity! Fresh muffins were amazing, and lots of tips for local hotspots and hiking!

Everything about 3 of Earth Farm is welcoming and cheerful. The simple breakfast is full of flavor and freshness and delight. The location is beautiful and soothing. The accommodations are clean and beautiful, full of color and whimsy. Staying here is like participating in a fabulous piece of art.

We highly recommend a stay at Gretchen's 3 of Earth Farm. The apartment overlooked the valley and was a very quiet and serene place to stay. The apartment was very comfortable and had everything we needed.

I was impressed with most everything. First, the place is large enough to be an apartment, all it would need is a kitchen. Next, she adds some personal touches to make you feel welcomed, including freshly made muffins. I arrived late, but it was not a problem, and I let myself in. You get a carport spot, private bathroom, and plenty of space for 2 people (possibly more but there is only a full size bed). She provides a ton of travel info, including tales of growing up in the area. I'd definitely stay again.

Falling asleep watching the stars is the most underrated experience in the world. From that bed you fall asleep to those starry skies and wake to singing birds. Breakfast goodies are the best you'll find anywhere and Gretchen is pure joy.

A whimsical, happy and lovely place. Three of the Earth is a delight. It’s comfy and roomy. Gretchen’s granola is even better than mine, her applesauce and muffins are simply delicious. This Airbnb is a treat to all your senses.
Gretchen was kind and set up her air mattress for us. My hubby and I are use to a king bed so the double bed would be a squeeze.
Be sure and check out Hub Bub, a wonderful shop filled with handmade treasures in Centralia. The owner is one of the sisters of Three of the Earth.

What a beautiful spot in the world ! Comfortable place to rest and write from. Whispering trees and a visiting hummingbird . Enjoyed my quiet time on my own, but also the little town is fun to explore and the merchants are very friendly and kind. Gretchen is a wonderful host !
This is a magical fairyland place, with a stunning view, gorgeous colors and lovely whimsical touches. So glad we made the trip from Mount Rainier, and stayed here on our way to Portland.
Very quaint place!! What a gem!! Quiet and close to town. Very spacious. Would recommend this place to my family and friends. Gretchen is prompt and a wonderful host. Thank you, Gretchen!!

I did the STP and her place wasn't far from the midway point. It was just what I needed when I was done. Her bed was great and so were her yummy treats. Next time I do the ride I will stay here again!

Gretchen's home far exceeded my expectations. The location, on the border of Seminary Hill Park and overlooking a beautiful farming valley, is awesome. Gretchen has decorated her home with artistic and spiritual touches. And the muffin with apple sauce, granola, and yogart breakfast! My stay at Gretchen's was perfect.
Gretchen's space is spectacular. A welcome respite for anyone seeking solitude and quiet. We loved it.
Such a lovely and restful place to stay. Beautiful surroundings and plenty of spots inside and out to relax and enjoy nature. Will be back again if I'm ever back in Centralia.

Gretchen's home was a delightful experience. There was plenty of space with the bedroom and the living room with a lovely view outside all of the windows. She was very communicative prior to our arrival, including directions as we arrived after dark. There was also a great breakfast spread for each morning that was there when we arrived including granola, muffins, and applesauce, all homemade! She even made us some GF trail bars. The bed was very comfortable and the room was dark in the mornings, even with the large windows. We had a very comfortable stay and highly recommend it to others.

Gretchen is such a lovely host. And her place is a little gem tucked away in a wooded area and so it stays cool even in warmer weather. We also got to see the deer up close in their garden in the meadow! It's such a serene environment and it was great to wake up to a great view. Her place is so unique and different from many airbnb places we've stayed in. I absolutely loved the breakfast options. It's a pity we needed to leave early for our visit to Mt. Rainier so we didn't get to try the vegan granola and apple sauce but the muffins were delicious! I would absolutely book this place again if we're ever in that area again. I highly recommend this place and try to stay longer than a day! Thank you so much, Gretchen!
Nice space. The train horn blew every hour or so all night long, though, so bring a pair of earplugs if you're a light sleeper.
Beautiful view of Mt St Helens. Tasteful comfy furniture and rooms. Friendly host. Healthy breakfast. Very clean.
Beautifully decorated clean and comfortable space. Stunning view of Mt St Helens and cozy private garden. Very quiet and wooded but a few minutes from town. Enjoy
Lovely property, great breakfast, very hospitable host!

Gretchen’s Farm, 3 of Earth, is an exquisite place to stay. Quiet, beautiful, bright, sparkling clean, and wonderful amenities like homemade granola and muffins, wonderful yogurt, and yummy coffee. The furniture is truly comfortable and inviting. One could NOT ask for anything more. Oh! And the bed! Comfy and wonderful linens with plenty of pillows, and an outstanding view of the valley and Mt. St. Helens! I never wanted to leave...♥️ (Writers: this is an outstanding place to stay to get some serious writing done.) Truly one of the best Air BnB’s I’ve ever stayed in. ♥️
Definitely a good choice for a couple
Great!

This charming cottage hit all promises and exceeded many! So clean, so well thought out, such a treat for the eyes. Beautifully curated art and furninshings...every corner has a special touch. Squeaky clean :) Located so very conveniently...4 minutes to anything! Especially loved their Guidebook! Very pleased and are plannig return stays to explore the area.

Cozy, comfy, and clean! Exactly as described by hosts. Convenient location and parking. As a minamalist I was worried the antiques and art would be too much but it is perfectly done! Great feel the minute you enter. Host was very responsive.

Very nice weekend stay at Holly and Jay's place. Adorable home with tons of charm and personality. Loved the artsy vibe. Most importantly, everything was spotless. Cute and cozy. Would stay here again.
Very accommodating and gracious. Would be happy to stay here again.
We felt really comfortable.

Comfortable, sparkling clean, delightful, I could keep going! To say our hosts were responsive would be an understatement!
We went for a short girls’ get-away and had such a great time. Centralia is a sweet little town with lots of food options and fun shops! We will be back!

Such a -cute- place! It doesn't feel anonymous; it has personality and charm. Small, but they make the most of the space, and it's clear they really care about their property. The Hosts are responsive and flexible. Recommended!
This is my favorite place in Centralia to stay. Super comfy, and super cute

Holly and Jay's place couldn't have been a cooler place to stay! It was thoughtfully decorated and we loved the style. It feels updated and comfortable while also having amazing vintage flair! There were great amenities and we generally felt very well taken care of. Holly and Jay were super responsive and kind hosts. We loved every bit of our experience there and would stay again in a heartbeat!

Loved the little cottage! I would stay there again. The shower was great & bed was comfortable. Easy access to the downtown where there is shopping, restaurants, & coffee.
Loved the Ghost Walk I attended. Centralia is a hidden gem!

This cozy little cottage is a perfect little get away spot. The decor is amazing and very tasteful. Hosts are responsive and helpful. There are some fun games and cute restaurants and shops close by. Only downside is the lack of kitchen ware. There is a sink and microwave as well as a mini forge and popcorn maker! But don’t count on a stovetop or oven.

Great cottage in a very convenient location. Super easy access to the house with great communication with the owner. Very clean and comfortable. I really loved all the eclectic art and stylish touches throughout, which made for a unique stay. Highly recommend, would definitely stay here again.

A great stay! Very comfortable bed, and great shower and great location. Really beautiful artwork through out cottage. There is no freezer just FYI- but fridge worked great. Will stay again if I am in the area!
A super cozy & comfortable place to stay! Hosts are very attentive, and the house is perfect!

Eccentric little place. Space is tight, but it has the basics. Make sure you remember there is no kitchen! The shower may look odd but it works really well! Good pressure and hot water. There is some road noise and you can hear the many trains that pass nearby from the bedroom.
Clean, centralized, and unique. Filled with beautiful pieces of art and cool furniture. This place is a must stay

Comfortable. Clean. Cute.
Well re-done older home. Enjoyed my stay and had everything I needed! Nice towels and sheets. Great hosts.
Very sweet and cozy little stay!
Clean and cozy antique cottage with very thoughtful touches. Close to outlets and town, I would recommend staying here if you are in the area!
Smaller sized place, but well decorated. Very comfortable bed. Bathroom is tight. Nice extras in the kitchen. A bit of road noise, but not much at night. Would definitely stay again.
My favorite, my only, place to stay in Centralia. A home away from home.

Thank you Holly & Jay,
I am so thankful to have been in Holly & Jays place- I shall def💥 recommenced you know o my friends, may you do as well (;*
Thank you so much!! Carol Beaman
Easy to get too, very cute little space. It was perfect for our needs.
Such a great place.
A cute, comfortable little cottage. A real home away from home.
Great location and great WIFI service - Small but clean
The place was easy to find, very close to the downtown area. Jay was very friendly and the place was spotless and it’s a very spacious house. I highly recommend.
Thank you for the amazing hospitality.

You know you are in for a delight when you arrive and your host is playing a guitar in the patio area...waiting to make sure you get checked in and know how to use everything.
Just all around great service.
Super clean place. Not just clean....super clean.
Great location with easy access to food/grocery/shopping, etc.
Would definitely go back.
Very clean and full of amenities that I had never seen in an airbnb before! I also liked that they were close to the location so checking in and out was quick and easy!
Jay and Holly’s place was very clean and had everything we needed! We loved the beautiful artwork around the cottage.
Nicely decorated and clean. They were organized and very welcoming. Had a nice stay!

Holly and Jay’s place was exactly what we were looking for on our trip back to my hometown...close to downtown and family. It’s a super stylish small space with lots of quirky artwork all over the walls. Everything was very clean and well appointed. We’ve already booked it for our trip back in August!

This cottage is stunning. It is in a prime location, perfect size for a couple, was well styled and comfortable. I would absolutely stay here again. Jay was extremely responsive to me whenever I needed anything. Five stars!
Adorable sparkling clean cottage, close to everything. Jay was very responsive to communication. Looking forward to staying there again in the future.
Cool place, cool art, very nice hosts
A cozy cottage getaway, perfect for a staycation.

Holly and Jay are amazing hosts with a really incredible little place. So many thoughtful touches. Quick to respond and very accommodating for us last minute. Would stay here again anytime we are passing through.

A very cute and comfortable cottage.
This is my home away from home in Centralia.
The owners take great care of the house, and are very responsive if there is anything I need.
Loved this little cottage. Quaint and cozy.
What a gem! The cottage is sweet, clean, comfy and perfect. The hosts are warm, responsive and helpful. I loved my long stay and can't wait to come back.
Stayed for softball tournament. Was close and convenient. Cute house, and great hosts.

House is in a sketchy neighborhood, with an abandoned house as neighbor. Way too much furniture for such a "cozy" space.
The bed was very comfortable and quilts were a nice homey touch.
Nice and convenient location. Especially for softball tournaments at the Hub.
Absolutely adorable space. Easy to find, very convenient & comfortable inside and out. Great communication with the host as well.
The cottage was exactly as described and Holly was kind and helpful with information about the area. We were very pleased with our stay.

This is a very nice place to stay in the middle of Centralia. It is close to the college and easy walking to "old" downtown, Tower street. The cabin was good for my family of four, and would be great for a couple spending time in Centralia. I liked the Art on the walls and the farm house charm. Holly and Jay were very easy to work with and I would highly recommend their place.
Great little location. Description is exactly what you get. Not to mention the awesome artwork. Overall a great stay!

Holly and Jay were quick to respond to questions, the house was clean and comfortable. Great place to stay for a night or two when visiting the area, not having a cook surface makes it more difficult for a longer stay. Would definitely rent here again.

This small house is in a good location for anything you might want to do in Centralia. The bed is comfortable and the home has many thoughtful touches. We visited during the holidays and the space was decorated for Christmas, which was a nice touch.

Very fast and easy booking and check in. Holy and Jay were great hosts. Communications was fast and the house was very cozy and comfortable. Will definatly stay again next time I'm in the area. Thanks again Holly and Jay!
Easy to find, better and bigger than expected.
This listing is cute and cozy
What amazing little space!! So cute and welcoming... stayed for a local softball tournament and the girls loved the little extra touches .. like makeup wipes and extra towels.

My husband and I stayed here after a wedding in Chehalis, so we got a night away from our 4 year old. Very cute and cozy cottage, comfortable bed, everything we needed. We had a great time! Would definitely stay here again if we are ever in the area.
Very cute and cozy place Comfortable bed and nice touches with local coffee and popcorn. Would definitely stay again if we come back into town.
Nice and simple place to stay, pleasant little cot

The hot water heater was not working, had taken a cold shower the first night. I reached out to host and they responded very late saying someone would be out to look at it. Nobody showed up. The host finally said the hot water heater should get replaced. We still had two nights to stay there with cold showers. I had 2 very small children with us and the ladder that goes to the loft rolls, which they have blocked with door stops, but as your walking up the ladder it still rolls out from under you. Very unsafe. There was an electrical outlet in the bathroom that was pulled away from wall exposing bare wires where children can reach. The bathroom had dirty mud smeared baseboards.
